jftlwHMwg2c.title: Spain’s Best Roast Lamb - SPOON CUT TENDER!! + Joselito Jamon Factory Tour!
jftlwHMwg2c.description:
🌶️ GHOST CHILI Available Now: https://amzn.to/3PNTvNQ (affiliate link to Amazon)
🇪🇸 Ultimate Valencia Paella Tour: https://youtu.be/rX_NDHkAtNQ
🔔 Subscribe: http://bit.ly/MarkWiensSubscribe

CAMPASPERO, SPAIN - Today we’re in the small village of Campaspero, Spain, about an hour and half north of Madrid. It’s very small, but the reason people come all the way here is to eat at Restaurante Mannix, a restaurant that’s known to serve some of the best fire roasted lamb in Spain! Today we also have the special opportunity to visit the factory of Joselito - widely considered to be one of the best Spanish hams in the world.

Restaurante Mannix (https://g.page/RestauranteMannix?share) - First lunch, and we saw a bit of the cooking process where they use locally raised lambs. The lambs are cooked in an adobe mud oven with orange fire wood. The result is that the lamb is insanely tender - they literally use a spoon to cut it up - and the skin is so crispy and juicy. Some of the best roast lamb I’ve ever had in my life. Restaurante Mannix is family run, and they are so hospitable and friendly. Price - €50 per plate of lamb

Joselito Jamon (https://www.joselito.com/en/home) - Next up we drove to Salamanca, Spain with Jose from Joselito. Joselito is known throughout Spain and the world for producing some of the best Spanish jamon in a natural way with no additives or preservatives. It was amazing to see the factory and the process that goes into it. The pigs are Iberico and 100% acorn fed. The taste is something truly magical.

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

rjdM6LNhiUs.title: Spanish Food - WORLD CHAMPION Paella Master!! | Trip to Spain’s Paella Capital!
rjdM6LNhiUs.description:
🌶️ GHOST CHILI Available Now: https://amzn.to/3PNTvNQ (affiliate link to Amazon)
🇪🇸 Ultimate Valencia Paella Tour: https://youtu.be/rX_NDHkAtNQ
🔔 Subscribe: http://bit.ly/MarkWiensSubscribe

EL PALMAR, SPAIN - Welcome to the small town of El Palmar in Valencia, Spain. This is a small town, but a special town because it’s the world capital of paella - a Spanish rice dish that originates from Valencia. Today we’ll be visiting a rice mill, then making a traditional Valencian paella with a world champion paella master. And finally we’ll be taking a boat trip to see the location where rice comes from.

Friends in the video:
Paco Alonso - WikiPaella (https://wikipaella.org/en/) - Huge thank you Paco!
Jeffrey Merrihue: https://www.instagram.com/xtremefoodies_/

Restaurante Bon Aire (https://goo.gl/maps/8uuseqvFWEbnoZev5) - We met up with Chef Raul, owner of Restaurante Bon Aire and who actually happens to be a world champion paella master. He’s known for his traditional Valencian paella. We made the entire recipe, starting from the beginning to the end, using the traditional ingredients that you must have for a Valencian paella. The paella was delicious, such an intense flavor of chicken and duck, snails, all simmered down to release their fat and flavor to absorb into the rice.
Total price - €420 for everything (6 adults)

It was another amazing paella day in Valencia!

If you haven’t already seen the Ultimate Paella tour in Valencia, make sure you watch it now: https://youtu.be/rX_NDHkAtNQ

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

Fgr_ke-brdA.title: Whole Grilled Turbot!! KING OF SEAFOOD - Grilled Fish Heaven at Restaurant Elkano, Spain!
Fgr_ke-brdA.description:
🌶️ GHOST CHILI Available Now: https://amzn.to/3PNTvNQ (affiliate link to Amazon)
🇪🇸 Ultimate Madrid Food Tour: https://youtu.be/iQIAtTJ9Sj4
🔔 Subscribe: http://bit.ly/MarkWiensSubscribe

GETARIA, SPAIN - Welcome to Getaria, a small coastal town in Northern Spain, and the place where they invented grilling the whole turbot! Today we’re eating at the legendary Elkano, one of the greatest seafood restaurants in Europe, and dedicated to grilled turbot.

Friends in the video: 
Gabriella Ranelli: https://www.tenedortours.com/
Jeffrey Merrihue: https://www.instagram.com/xtremefoodies_/

Elkano is a legendary seafood restaurant throughout Spain. The restaurant was originally started by Mr. Pedro, who is credited with being the first to grill an entire whole turbot. The restaurant is currently run by Mr. Aitor Arregui, the son of Pedro. They specialize in the ultra freshest and best quality seafood, prepared simply.

A few of my favorite dishes of the meal were the spider crab, deshelled and mixed with the head butter; Atlantic blue lobster with its roe; and the whole grilled turbot fish. Almost everything you’ll eat at Restaurant Elkano will be from the grill, with simple preparations to highlight the seafood without covering it up. Again, Elkano is yet another example of Spanish food - taking the best quality ingredients and simply preparing them.

All the food was delicious, but without a doubt the highlight was the whole grilled turbot - the fish that no one leaves without trying. Mr. Aitor brought it to our table and parts it out into each individual piece that has a different flavor and texture. He then proceeds to make a pil pil sauce on the fish plate from the fatty protein of the fish. It’s truly incredible. One of the greatest fish parting outs of the world!

Elkano (https://goo.gl/maps/6LQiC7poGMEKU1KLA)
Total price - €491.74 (for 3 people)

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

vPmOG49G0RM.title: Whole Fish + Northern Thai Food in 130 Year Old Teak Mansion! | Kiti Panit (กิติพานิช), Chiang Mai
vPmOG49G0RM.description:
Kiti Pani (กิติพานิช) restaurant in Chiang Mai!
🍜 $1 Noodles, Million Dollar View! https://youtu.be/7HBLxO55nts

CHIANG MAI, THAILAND - Welcome to Chiang Mai, and today we’re going to Kiti Panit (กิติพานิช), which is a northern Thai restaurant within a 130 year old teakwood mansion in the heart of Old Chiang Mai. The mansion has a history of being the first General Store in Chiang Mai.

Not only is this a great restaurant to eat at, but it’s also traveling back in time and it’s actually a museum at the same time as it’s a restaurant.

For the food, we ordered a range of different dishes, all based on Northern Thai cuisine, but dishes make use of high quality ingredients.

The khao soi - curry egg noodles was fantastic - so incredibly rich and thick and hearty. I also loved the fried chicken wings with makwaen, a flowery spice that’s related to Sichuan pepper. Finally the other highlight dish was their gaeng hanglay, a Burmese Shan pork curry. This is no doubt one of the richest and meatiest versions you’ll have.

Recommended for a nice sit down northern Thai food restaurant when you’re in Chiang Mai, in a historical location.

📍Kiti Panit กิติพานิช, Chiang Mai - https://goo.gl/maps/HVATdv1cZnarPcCk7

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

wR7dmLR5fuQ.title: Street Food "Deep Fried Papaya" + 500 Meter Bamboo Bridge! | Mae Hong Son, Thailand
wR7dmLR5fuQ.description:
🍜 $1 Noodles, Million Dollar View! https://youtu.be/7HBLxO55nts

MAE HONG SON, THAILAND (แม่ฮ่องสอน) - Mae Hong Son is one of my favorite provinces in Thailand for its amazing scenery and mountains, people groups, and delicious food. Today we’re first eating some local street food and then we’ll cross a long 500 meter bamboo bridge over the rice paddy fields.

Khao Sen Ba Kon ข้าวเส้นป้าคนธ์ (https://goo.gl/maps/qAf62NeVqyNgXB3S7) - First we’re going to eat lunch - a local Shan lunch of khao sen, rice noodles and a tomato stew - paired with an amazing plate of deep fried veggies especially fried papaya. 

Su Tong Pae Bridge (สะพานซูตองเป้) - Perhaps once the longest bamboo bridge in Thailand (I don’t think it is anymore), Su Tong Pae Bridge (สะพานซูตองเป้) is a beautiful bamboo bridge which crosses over a rice paddy filled valley from one village to another with access to the Shan temple. It’s a fantastic place to visit when you’re in Mae Hong Son.

And that completes a great day of relaxing, eating, and sightseeing in Mae Hong Son, Thailand.

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

uovUu3fs5eQ.title: Thailand’s Best Cave - Riding a Bamboo Raft! | Nam Lod Cave (ถ้ำน้ำลอด), Mae Hong Son
uovUu3fs5eQ.description:
We’re visiting Nam Lod Cave (ถ้ำน้ำลอด) in Mae Hong Son, Thailand!
🍜 $1 Noodles, Million Dollar View! https://youtu.be/7HBLxO55nts

MAE HONG SON (แม่ฮ่องสอน), THAILAND - We’re in Mae Hong Son, one of the most spectacular nature oriented and remote provinces in Thailand.

Today we’re visiting the amazing Nam Lod Cave (ถ้ำน้ำลอด), which is about an hour drive from the city of Pai - it also happens to be the best cave I’ve ever visited in Thailand. Part of the reason it’s so cool is that you take a bamboo raft straight through the center of the cave floating on a river, teeming with fish. It’s almost surreal to be within the tunnel, water flowing, fish all around you without any light but the lantern.

Along with the bamboo raft ride, we also walked around the cave, saw some of the most important sights, and a series of ancient coffins high in a cavern.

Highly recommended as one of the best cave experiences in Thailand!

Places visited in this video:

1. Tham Pla (Fish Cave) - https://goo.gl/maps/Z9Y5dnpAfg61NRGz9, price - 100 THB per adult

2. Nam Lod Cave ถ้ำน้ำลอด - https://goo.gl/maps/SGV4jVXSgwbw8KbM7, price - 500 THB for a boat and guide for 2 people, visiting all 3 caves

3. Simple Thai lunch at Nongluk - https://goo.gl/maps/XUx5xTooDrKgriNw8 

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

7HBLxO55nts.title: $1 Noodle Soup, Million Dollar View!! | Ban Jabo (บ้านจ่าโบ), Mae Hong Son, Thailand!
7HBLxO55nts.description:
Welcome to Ban Jabo (บ้านจ่าโบ) village in Mae Hong Son, Thailand!
🍜 Amazing Beef Khao Soi: https://youtu.be/MVeY00ApNbY

MAE HONG SON, THAILAND (แม่ฮ่องสอน)  - Today we’re in Mae Hong Son province in northern Thailand and going to explore the small village of Ban Jabo (บ้านจ่าโบ). The village is within the mountains and extremely picturesque. It’s quite famous for its noodle restaurants where you can dangle your feet off the edge of the restaurant while slurping down your bowl of noodles. And I’ll tell you, it’s well worth it!

Ban Cha Bo Hill Noodle (https://goo.gl/maps/V49Fui4fVE8sN6tA9), Price - 35 THB ($1.05) - To be honest it probably won’t be the best bowl of noodles you’ve ever had, it was pretty simple and a pretty standard Thai bowl of pork noodles. But the view and the atmosphere is really what stands out.

Dekdoi Coffee (https://goo.gl/maps/ujYPcbgD8vVUqmU16) - After eating we headed up the road to have a quick cup of coffee. A great place, highly recommended.

Ban Jabo (บ้านจ่าโบ) is a beautiful village in Northern Thailand and next time I would love to spend more time there and stay at a homestay.

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

Ban Jabo (บ้านจ่าโบ) is a beautiful village in Northern Thailand and next time I would love to spend more time there and stay at a homestay.

Mae Hong Son (แม่ฮ่องสอน) - During my recent trip to Mae Hong Son province in northern Thailand, we had a chance to visit Ban Rak Thai (บ้านรักไทย), which is a gorgeous Chinese Yunnanese village in the mountains. 

It’s a very famous tourist destination, especially for Thais because of the amazing scenery in the remote mountains, preserved Chinese culture, and the tea fields. During our time in Ban Rak Thai (บ้านรักไทย) we stayed at Lee Wine Rak Resort (ลีไวน์รักไทยรีสอร์ท), one of the most famous hotels / tea resorts in the village. It’s also extremely picturesque with Chinese style villas going up the side of the mountain and the tea fields. In this video I’m going to give you a full tour of our tea resort hotel room!

MVeY00ApNbY.title: Thai Street Food BEEF KHAO SOI CURRY! Amazing Hidden Gem in Chiang Mai (ข้าวซอยลุงสุรินทร์)!
MVeY00ApNbY.description:
Amazing hidden gem Khao Soi in Chiang Mai, Thailand with @Joel Bruner 
🇹🇭 Karen Food - Wild Jungle Food: https://youtu.be/Bv4B3vvjNsg

CHIANG MAI, THAILAND - Welcome to Chiang Mai, northern Thailand. I’m hanging out with my friend @Joel Bruner , and today we’re going to go eat a bowl of khao soi that is truly a hidden gem!

Khao Soi Loong Surin (ข้าวซอยลุงสุรินทร์ (https://goo.gl/maps/isXi7DFoCmP9pR4T9) has a very cool story. The Uncle formerly sold his khao soi (ข้าวซอย) within Chiang Mai city near the university. But some 30 years ago he had enough of the city and decided to move to Doi Pui in the mountains just outside of the city. He opened his curry noodle stall within the Hmong village of Doi Pui.

Joel and first had a bowl of beef khao soi, which was outstanding, so rich and so creamy and so meaty. Then we had a bowl of chicken. The beef was the winner without a doubt, but really, you can’t go wrong.

It’s amazing that you’re just a 30 minute driver from the center of Chiang Mai, and yet it’s a totally different world - cold weather, mountain breeze, and some of the richest and best khao soi curry noodles that you’ll find in Chiang Mai!

📍 Khao Soi Loong Surin (ข้าวซอยลุงสุรินทร์ (https://goo.gl/maps/isXi7DFoCmP9pR4T9)

📺 Joel’s Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrtRLTcGy-CPac-JwMuuHgQ

Ww5JKORuo5U.title: $130 Pool Villa in Phuket!! Anantara Mai Khao 5 Star Hotel Tour + Breakfast Pad See Ew!
Ww5JKORuo5U.description:

👕 NEW T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/
📍 Anantara Mai Khao Phuket (โรงแรมอนันตรา ภูเก็ต วิลล่าส์): https://g.page/anantara-mai-khao-phuket-villas?share

PHUKET, THAILAND (ภูเก็ต) - Welcome to Anantara Mai Khao Phuket Villas! We got a great deal and stayed for 4 nights. The hotel is fantastic, staff were so friendly and helpful, the pool villa was relaxing, and the grounds of the hotel - right along the beach - are beautiful.

When you go to Phuket, one of the things you always have to keep in mind is how big the island is. It’s 50 km in length and can take 1 - 1.5 hours to drive from the north to the south. This hotel, Anantara Mai Khao Phuket villas is located along Mai Khao Beach, which is one of the most quiet and relaxing areas of Phuket at the very northern end of the island. Come here if you want peace and quiet and want to be away from action and too many other people. But keep in mind it’s about 45 minutes to Phuket town.

We really enjoyed our stay, and again it’s a perfect place for families or if you want to be in a quiet and relaxing place. We got a really good deal on our stay at right about $130 per night. But usually for this pool villa it would probably cost more.

DVlr0cPGvps.title: We stayed in a 100 YEAR OLD WOODEN HOUSE - Shan Village Life + Best Breakfast!
DVlr0cPGvps.description:
🎥 Visiting Ancient Salt Wells: https://youtu.be/7i3Khv78Z4s
👕 NEW T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/
📍 Homestay: https://goo.gl/maps/i4HsXTQDEzJdnHQa6

MAE HONG SON (แม่ฮ่องสอน), THAILAND - When I was in Mae Hong Son, a province in Northwestern Thailand on the border of Myanmar, I had an honor to stay in a Shan Village (ไทใหญ่) called Muang Pon, at a homestay. 

The house was a traditional 100 year old wooden house with a leaf roof. In this video I’m going to give you a full tour of the homestay in this amazing village, and we’ll learn a lot about the Shan culture. 

It was quite cold when we visited (filmed in December), and it felt great to wear a jacket in the morning. There’s nothing better than waking up to the smoke of a fire, coffee, and hot rice congee porridge brewing. We had congee, fried local river fish, and the highlight for me - crispy fried local grown garlic. Amazing meal, and and incredible house.

Price - 450 THB ($14.36) per person, per night

🏠 Highly recommended Homestay in Muang Pon village (https://goo.gl/maps/i4HsXTQDEzJdnHQa6). You can contact them to stay there and cook meals for you here: https://www.facebook.com/ecbykroopui/

mEvHQqzTykA.title: Famous FRIED CHICKEN!! 🍗 Mountain Lodge Tour + Dinner & Breakfast in Nan (น่าน), Thailand!
mEvHQqzTykA.description:
🎥 Visiting Ancient Salt Wells: https://youtu.be/7i3Khv78Z4s
👕 NEW T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/

Nan (น่าน), Thailand - Welcome to Nan, one of the most beautiful and relaxing provinces in northern Thailand. On this trip we visited Bo Kluea (บ่อเกลือ), which is a small village in the mountains known for its natural salt wells where they have harvested salt for over centuries. It’s amazing place to visit and learn about the history and the trade of salt in the area. In this video though, I’m give you a tour of the hotel we stayed at, probably the best hotel in the village, and we’re going to eat their famous fried chicken!

Boklua View Hotel (บ่อเกลือวิว รีสอร์ท https://goo.gl/maps/yd36MissjkVKiURx7) - It’s a great hotel / mountain lodge, right within the village and the mountains. From the lodge, it’s just about a 5 minute walk to the salt wells and the main walking street of the village. When you’re at the hotel, there are plenty of gardens and areas to explore and walk around. You also have a selection of different types of rooms and bungalows available. Our was all the way at the back and the top of the property.

For dinner we went to the lodge restaurant, which is very popular among Thais, both on day trips and almost everyone who stays at the lodge eats there for dinner. So you must make a booking for dinner. Along with the roasted pumpkin, one of their signature dishes is the mahkwen fried chicken, a spice that’s similar to Sichuan pepper. The fried chicken was delicious, very Chinese chili fried chicken style, dry fried, without a batter. They used a local free range chicken, so it had some delicious texture too. Amazing dish, must eat when you’re in Bo Kluea (บ่อเกลือ).

We had a great stay at Boklua View Hotel (บ่อเกลือวิว รีสอร์ท). I think the best thing about it is the natural setting, and the special fried chicken.

https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

7i3Khv78Z4s.title: Visiting the Ancient Salt Wells 🧂+ Khao Soi Noodles!! | Bo Kluea (บ่อเกลือ), Nan, Thailand
7i3Khv78Z4s.description:
🎥 HillTribe Eco Lodge Tour: https://youtu.be/h-4uGHvtXYg
👕 NEW T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/

Nan (น่าน), Thailand - Welcome to Nan, one of the most beautiful and laid back provinces in Northern Thailand. Today we are going to Bo Kluea (บ่อเกลือ), the legendary natural salt wells. People have been coming to this village in the mountains for centuries to trade salt. It’s an amazing place to visit when you’re in Thailand and here’s a guide for what to do when you visit.

So the actual village is called Ban Bo Luang (บ้านบ่อหลวง), but most people just know it as Bo Kluea (บ่อเกลือ), the salt wells. It was about a 2 hour drive from the city of Nan to get to Bo Kluea (บ่อเกลือ) and the drive is spectacular.

Once you’re there, the main thing to do is visit the salt wells, which are right along the main road in the village, you can’t miss it. First have a look at the actual wells that produce salty water. Then you can navigate your way to one of the huts where they still boil the water over wood, to evaporate the water and leaf huge mineral salt crystals. Since times have changed, and people are no longer trading salt, the community has shifted to tourism - especially Thai local tourism, and they make a series of salt products that you can buy to support them.

Khao soi - 30 THB ($0.95) - We were getting hungry, so for lunch we had a delicious bowl of khao soi, Thai curry noodles. The restaurant is just past the first salt wells. Curry noodles were delicious and Aunty was friendly.

Highly recommended to visit Bo Kluea (บ่อเกลือ) when you visit Nan, Thailand!

https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

XlA-klHJ-sQ.description:
🎥 Thai Fruit Shakes in Songkhla, Thailand: https://youtu.be/R5EnPDkHlQc
👕 NEW T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/

KRABI, THAILAND (กระบี่) - Welcome to Krabi, one of the most beautiful provinces in Southern Thailand. Krabi is known for its amazing islands, and you can take a day trip just off the coast of Ao Nang to see some of the spectacular islands, and go snorkeling, and swimming. Today we’re going on a family long-tail boat trip and I’ll share the details and tips with you. #Krabi #Thailand #beach

We took a relatively short day trip, there are other islands you can visit, but we mainly went to a few of the close islands - really good for a family day trip, or if you have kids.

Thale Waek - First beach we went to, and there is a 400 THB ($12.68) entrance fee as it’s a Thailand national park. The beach is very nice and quite unique with its sand bars. But I liked the snorkeling even better around the side of the island.

Chicken Rock - One of the famous small islands off the coast of Krabi is Koh Gai, or chicken rock island. Mostly you just sail past it and get a nice view.

Koh Poda - Finally, on this island hopping tour in Krabi, we went to Koh Poda, a wonderful island with great beaches. This is where we had lunch and it’s a popular place to hang out, relax, and swim.

Total Price - 2,000 THB ($63.41) for the entire boat, and if you can get a few more people to join, it would be more affordable. We just arranged our boat directly from the official kiosk at Khlong Haeng.

JDLN3sGf9Yc.title: Day 1 in Satun, Thailand!! Seafood Dinner, Night Market + Tour of Satun!
JDLN3sGf9Yc.description:
🎥 Amazing Cast Rock Cove in Satun: https://youtu.be/Srm4C0NBL1E
👕 NEW T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/

SATUN, THAILAND (สตูล): Welcome to Satun, the province and city in the very far southwest of Thailand, along the Andaman sea coast, and bordering Malaysia. It was my first trip to Satun, and I was excited to walk around, explore, eat, and learn about the culture. #Satun #Thailand #travelvlog

For the full Satun street food tour, you can watch this video: https://youtu.be/C2yd1Sj0JZ8

But in this video, I share my first impressions of Satun on a walking tour of this laid back city. We started off at the national museum where you’ll find some beautiful paintings and murals on the wall.

One of the main landmarks and most important places in Satun is the Satun Central Mosque, located right in the heart of the city. In the center is also the clock tower. It’s a great place to walk around, and get your bearings. 

For an early dinner we stopped at Nong Nee Restaurant (ร้านอาหารน้องณี), a Thai Chinese seafood restaurant. The food was overall quite delicious. Recommended when you’re in Satun. Total price - 1,040 THB ($33.20)

Finally to fish this tour of Satun, if happened to be Saturday, and on Saturday’s there’s a walking street night market in Satun. Great place to walk around and enjoy the atmosphere of Satun.

And that completes our first full day in Satun!

AilMnYflY78.title: Family Sunrise Breakfast!! Off The Beaten Path Travel in Chiang Rai, Northern Thailand!
AilMnYflY78.description:
🎥 Lanjia Lodge Tour: https://youtu.be/h-4uGHvtXYg
📍 Lanjia Lodge: https://www.asian-oasis.com/lanjia/
👕 T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/

CHIANG RAI, THAILAND - Welcome to the beautiful mountains of Chiang Rai, and specifically to Lanjia Lodge, where we arranged to have a sunrise breakfast.

We woke up to a very cold morning, and it was just a 15 or 20 minute walk though the village and to the other side of the ridge to have a better view of the morning sunrise. From the top, it was even colder because of the wind whipping across the top of the hill. After arriving to the rest hut, we unloaded our gear and breakfast, and started drinking some coffee, to wait for the sunrise.

Breakfast included Thai grilled pork and sticky rice, muffins, local oranges, yoghurt, granola, coffee and tea. It was fantastic.

Part of what made our family sunrise breakfast so special was also just that it’s not a tourist location, so it’s completely quiet, peaceful, nature, and the beauty is spectacular.

📍 Lanjia Lodge: https://www.asian-oasis.com/lanjia/

Pnw8AJOC_Ww.title: Unforgettable Lunch in Northern Thailand!! 🎋 Aunty Cooks MOUNTAIN THAI FOOD in Chiang Rai!
Pnw8AJOC_Ww.description:
🎥 WATCH: Lanjia Lodge Tour: https://youtu.be/h-4uGHvtXYg
📍 Lanjia Lodge: https://www.asian-oasis.com/lanjia/
👕 T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/

CHIANG RAI, THAILAND - Welcome to Chiang Rai, in the mountains at the spectacular Lanjia Lodge. On our first day, right as we arrived, we were welcomed with a spectacular local Northern Thai food lunch, and I’m going to share it all with you in this video.

First, let’s all meet Pa Nim, who is a local Aunty, and a legend for her home cooking skills. In fact, she used to have a restaurant of her own. But now cooks occasionally for events, or upon request. 

Today, she made a huge feast for lunch. The food she made was Northern Thai food style, but influenced by the region, Hill Tribe cooking and ingredients. It was a superb meal. Some of the notable dishes for me were the green taro stem curry with catfish, the bamboo shoot salad mixture - life changing delicious, and the pounded grilled catfish chili dip. She was so fast cooking, and truly a memorable meal experience. On top of the great food, it's hard to have a better location to eat!

📍 Lanjia Lodge: https://www.asian-oasis.com/lanjia/

h-4uGHvtXYg.title: Hill Tribe Eco Lodge -  $163 ROOM TOUR + Dinner & Breakfast! | Lanjia Lodge, Chiang Rai, Thailand
h-4uGHvtXYg.description:
🎥 Hmong Village Food: https://youtu.be/KyFUmf-eXTE
🔥 Lanjia Lodge: https://www.asian-oasis.com/lanjia/
👕 T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/

LANJIA LODGE - Welcome to Lanjia Lodge, an eco friendly lodge, run and supporting a number of local Hill Tribe communities. I was excited to stay here for many reasons - the natural beauty of the mountains and views, the natural feel of everything, and how when you stay here, you’re directly supporting the community. So in this video, I’ll be giving you a full tour of our cottage, so you can know what to expect when you stay at Lanjia Lodge! #ChiangRai #Thailand #LanjiaLodge

First of all, one of the greatest things about Lanjia Lodge is that it’s integrated into the community. There are both Hmong and Lahu people within the village, and staying at Lanjia Lodge is an opportunity to learn about both of these peoples. In fact, a stay includes a walking tour of the village, plus a visit to the traditional shaman of the village.

Additionally, it’s an all inclusive stay, so the price includes accommodation, dinner and breakfast, cultural musical performance at night, and a walking tour.

Price - We paid about 5,000 THB ($163.34) per night for 3 of us, and again it’s all inclusive, while directly supporting the community in an ethical way.

In addition to learning about the Hmong and Lahu, Lanjia Lodge is just one of the most relaxing, chilled out places. We loved our stay, and great for family and kids.

📍 Lanjia Lodge: https://www.asian-oasis.com/lanjia/

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

R5EnPDkHlQc.title: Family Island Tour - FRUIT SHAKES on Thailand’s Biggest Lake!! | Songkhla, Thailand
R5EnPDkHlQc.description:
🎥 Family Boat Trip in Phatthalung: https://youtu.be/VuYOT_UhMQI
👕 T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/

Koh Yo (เกาะยอ) Island - Welcome to the province of Songkhla in Southern Thailand, and what is the largest natural lake in Thailand - Lake Songkhla. It’s magically peaceful and chilled out place, and today we’re going on a day trip to Koh Yo (เกาะยอ) Island within the lake.

Though the island is small, it’s known for a number of things, including fruit, a certain pattern of textile, and traditional Southern Thai culture. Also, the island is connected by a series of bridges, so it’s easy to access from the mainland. 

Khao Yam (ร้านข้าวยำป้าลิ่มเกาะยอ) - https://goo.gl/maps/zRj3fWyzVLoN4TRe8 - First place we stopped is a small family restaurant to eat Southern Thai rice herbal salad. It was great, so refreshing and a balance of sweet, salty, and spicy.
Price - 20 THB ($0.66) per plate

Lung Wee Garden (สวนลุงวี https://goo.gl/maps/c5oGbJ4HpqEUzdNj9) - I was just searching on the map and found Uncle Wee garden, and since we were right down the road, we decided to stop by. He happened to be there, and he’s extremely friendly. One of the main things he grows is a cross breed of cempedak and jackfruit.

Khatichon Wittaya Museum (Folklore Museum Southern Thailand https://goo.gl/maps/9pHCWN3n7RPSgxxf7) - Next up on this family island tour, we stopped at the main folklore museum, called Khatichon Wittaya Museum. Definitely worth a visit to learn more about the province of Songkhla and cultures of Southern Thailand.

Chill bar koh yor (https://goo.gl/maps/TaeL6B1V9uaFdnBJ8) - There were a few cafes that looked great on the island, but they were all closed, so luckily Chill Bar was open - and that’s exactly what it is, chill to the max. They make great fruit shakes!

And that completes our tour of Koh Yo (เกาะยอ) Island in Lake Songkhla, Thailand. Great place to visit, very chill and peaceful.

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

M_W-bwKatYg.title: Best TURMERIC FISH FRIES!! Southern Thai Food in Trang, Thailand!
M_W-bwKatYg.description:
🎥 Family Boat Trip in Phatthalung: https://youtu.be/VuYOT_UhMQI
👕 T-shirts and caps available now: https://migrationology.com/store/

TRANG, THAILAND (ตรัง) -  Khrua Thong Na Tham (ร้านครัวท่องนาท่าม) is a legendary Southern Thai food restaurant in the southern Thailand province of Trang. I loved the look of the restaurant from the moment we arrived - situated in a series of stilted wooden shelters - throughout Thailand, this is the type of restaurant where you’ll find the best food. #Thailand #Trang #ThaiFood

We ordered 7 or 8 of their specialty main dishes, including catfish curry, Southern Thai sour curry, stink beans, fern salad, melinjo leaves with egg, and deep fried sand fish with turmeric and garlic.

Most of the food was delicious and spicy. A few of the dishes like the sour curry were not my favorite as it was a little on the sweeter side - but it was still good and with a nice balance of flavor.

Overall, great eating experience, recommended for local southern Thai food when you’re in Trang, Thailand!

📍 Khrua Thong Na Tham (ร้านครัวท่องนาท่าม) - https://goo.gl/maps/tBFHnaWkywr8H5z86

Total price - To be honest I forgot to write down the price of this meal, but I think it was about 600 - 800 THB for everything we ordered. Around $20 - $25.

VuYOT_UhMQI.title: Family Boat Trip!! LOTUS LAKE + Homestay Thai Food! | Unseen Thailand, Thale Noi, Phatthalung
VuYOT_UhMQI.description:
Unseen Thailand travel adventure - Thale Noi in Phatthalung!
🔥 Thailand Village Life - https://youtu.be/_Tu7nypKadM

Thale Noi (ทะเลน้อย) - Welcome to Phatthalung, Thailand, one of the most relaxing provinces in Thailand. People are cool, food is delicious, and there’s some spectacular off the beaten path things to do. Part of the reason why Phatthalung is a lesser visited province in Southern Thailand is because they don’t have an ocean coastline like most other Southern Thai provinces. However, they do have a huge lake - one of them being Thale Noi (ทะเลน้อย). Today we’re going on a boat tour of Thale Noi, and then I’ll give you a tour of our homestay, plus we’ll have a quick local Thai food dinner at the house.

Thale Noi tour - you’ll want to arrive between 6 - 7 am because in the morning is when you’ll see the pink and white lotus in full bloom. The lake is spectacular, so peaceful and calming, and so beautiful wich so much vegetation. Highlight recommended. Price - 450 THB ($15.07) per hour

During out time at in Phatthalung at Thale Noi (ทะเลน้อย), we stayed at Uncle Sanan Homestay (โฮมสเตย์ ลุงสนั่น). He’s quite a character and his house is traditional, old, made of wood, and full of antiques. Him and his wife are also great local cooks who cook Southern Thai food. Recommended for a night or two if you really want to learn about the Southern Thai food and culture of Phatthalung along the lake.

And so that wraps up this tour in Phatthalung. An amazing day and spectacular place - a really off the beaten path, unseen Thailand attraction.

📍 Uncle Sanan Homestay (โฮมสเตย์ ลุงสนั่น บ้านปากประ https://goo.gl/maps/smJvxMJXchw2N6nz8) - Price - 1,500 THB ($50.20) per night

_Tu7nypKadM.title: Village Life in Thailand - Breakfast + Massage in 100 Year Old Wooden House!
_Tu7nypKadM.description:
🔥 Thai Fire Chili Noodles - https://youtu.be/4fUTxO7blAY

Welcome to Ban Na Thon Village (บ้านนาถ่อน) which is located in the Nakhon Phanom province of Northeastern Thailand! It’s such a relaxed and chilled out village, near the Mekong River. We stayed at a local home-stay with an Grandmother in a wooden house over 100 years old. In this video I’ll give you a full tour, walk you around, do some activities in the village, and eat breakfast - and take a shower!

The village is beautiful, people are so friendly, the food is delicious, and also what’s cool is that this Ban Na Thon Village (บ้านนาถ่อน) has developed its community tourism, offering opportunities to stay in the village and learn about the culture.

We had an amazing stay, and I would highly recommend it.

Ban Na Thon Village (บ้านนาถ่อน) offers homestay programs and activities - https://www.thailandvillageacademy.com/22-villages/nathon-cultural-tourism-community-nakhon-phanom/

NAKHON PHANOM, THAILAND (นครพนม) - Welcome to Nakhon Phanom, a quiet province and town in Northeastern Thailand, along the beautiful Mekong River. This area of Thailand has a lot of history and influence from both Laos and Vietnam. #NakhonPhanom #VietnameseFood #travel

Today, we’re going on a sightseeing tour of attractions in Nakhon Phanom, and we’ll also eat some of the most famous Vietnamese food in town - and one of the greatest eggs in a noodle blanket. The noodles are some of the softest and silkiest I’ve ever had.

Nakhon Phanom is so relaxing and peaceful, people are friendly, and the Vietnamese food is delicious!

4fUTxO7blAY.title: Eating SPICY FIRE NOODLES  🔥 🌶️ + Sacred Temple | Nakhon Phanom, Thailand
4fUTxO7blAY.description:
Travel Guide to Nakhon Phanom, Thailand! 
🎥 WATCH NEXT: Thailand’s Most Dangerous Temple - https://youtu.be/_Xsy9-DGR2w

NAKHON PHANOM, THAILAND (นครพนม) - Welcome to Nakhon Phanom, a quiet and peaceful province in the Isan Northeastern region of Thailand, along the Mekong River. You’ll immediately notice how life takes on a much more relaxed and slower pace when you’re here. Today, we’re visiting one of the most revered pagoda temples in Isan and then eating a fiery spicy bowl of rice noodles and fermented fish sauce. This is Day 1 in Nakhon Phanom. #NakhonPhanom #Thailand #ThaiFood

That Phanom, Thailand - Located in Nakhon Phanom province, That Phanom is a city that’s famous for its temple.

Wat Phra That Phanom (วัดพระธาตุพนมวรมหาวิหาร) - The main pagoda dates back to sometime in the 6th - 9th century, but it was rebuilt again in the 16th century by the King of Laos. It’s highly revered and a pilgrimage destination because it is said to have a breast bone of Buddha.

Perm Poon Khanom Jeen (เพิ่มพูลขนมจีน) - The highlight of my day was lunch at a restaurant called Perm Poon Khanom Jeen (เพิ่มพูลขนมจีน), known for fresh rice noodles, fermented fish sauce, and insanely spicy chilies. It was sensational, especially with a sprinkle of white popinac seeds (aka mini stink beans) poured all over. Delicious, highly recommended.
Total price - 30 THB ($1) per plate

Thank you for watching this Day 1 in Nakhon Phanom, Isan, Thailand, and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

_cM_6jkYTek.title: We Stayed in a Rice Paddy Hotel!! 🌾 Breakfast + Dinosaur Footprints 🦖 | Kalasin, Thailand
_cM_6jkYTek.description:
🎥 WATCH NEXT - 3 Whales Rock in Buang Kan: https://youtu.be/22JvSzk2138

Kalasin (กาฬสินธุ์), Thailand - Welcome to Kalasin, a peaceful province in the Isaan region of northeastern Thailand. It’s known for agriculture - specifically rice - and dinosaurs. So today I’m going to give you a full tour of our bungalow in the rice fields and then we’ll step in the footsteps of dinosaurs in Thailand!

Non Na Muang Phu (นอนนา@เมืองภู) - After a huge street food tour of Kalasin (you can watch that video here: https://youtu.be/m7nvdUEa-4Y) we drove about an hour into the countryside to Non Na Muang Phu (นอนนา@เมืองภู). It’s a hotel (bungalows), restaurant, coffee shop, and it’s even just almost like a park where people come to hang out and take pictures. We were lucky to get a last minute reservation (this place is very popular for Thais), and I’m going to give you a full tour of our room accommodation, private bungalow and the rice fields.

Price - 1,200 THB ($38.66) per night, including breakfast

Phu Faek Forest Park - During the afternoon we drove over to Phu Faek Forest Park, known for its giant dinosaur footprints within the rocks along the stream. It really was cool, and what I also really liked about it is that it’s really off the beaten path so we were the only ones there when we visited.

Thanks for watching this accommodation and travel guide in Kalasin, Thailand. Hope you’re having a fantastic day!

22JvSzk2138.title: Unseen Attractions in Thailand - Amazing 3 Whales Rock  🐳🐳🐳  | Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ)
22JvSzk2138.description:
3 Whales Rock (หินสามวาฬ) - Amazing nature in Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ), Thailand
🎥 WATCH NEXT - Most Dangerous Temple in Thailand: 

Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ), Thailand - Welcome to Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ) a province in the very northeastern part of Thailand, and along the Mekong River. It’s a very peaceful, lesser visited province in Thailand, and I think it’s an amazing unseen destination to travel to, especially if you love nature and the outdoors. #BuengKan #Thailand #3WhalesRock

Along with visiting Wat Phu Tok (วัดภูทอก) Temple - which might be the most adventurous temple you can visit in Thailand - Bueng Kan is home to 3 Whales Rock (หินสามวาฬ), a natural formation of rocks, jetting out of seemingly nowhere, that looks like a family of three whales.

To get there, it’s about a 30 minute drive from Bueng Kan city, heading to Phu Sing National Park. They charge 500 THB ($16.72) for entire truck, so you can pool with other people if you like, or you can take the private truck, which is still affordable. I think they’ve done a great job with the tour so it remains pristine and natural. Along with seeing the amazing 3 whales rock, you’ll also visit a few more sights within the park - but nothing compares to the 3 whales rock. 

If you’re looking for off the beaten path things to do and attractions in Thailand, Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ) is an amazing places to visit, and don’t miss 3 Whales Rock (หินสามวาฬ).

Navel of the Mekong - Additionally, later in the afternoon, we stopped by at the Navel of the Mekong to see this landmark in the mighty river.

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

_Xsy9-DGR2w.title: One Slip, 300 Meter Fall!! Thailand’s Most DANGEROUS Temple! | Wat Phu Tok (วัดภูทอก), Bueng Kan
_Xsy9-DGR2w.description:
Wat Phu Tok (วัดภูทอก) Temple in Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ), Thailand!
🎥 Castle Rock Cove in Satun: https://youtu.be/Srm4C0NBL1E

Welcome to Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ), the ultra relaxing province in the Isaan region of Northeastern Thailand, on the Mekong River. It’s a place you can visit for relaxation, Isaan culture, and especially adventure and nature. One of the places I was most looking forward to visiting in Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ) is a temple that’s built on and surrounding red mountain rock, called Wat Jetiyakhiri (วัดเจติยาคิรีวิหาร) or better known as Wat Phu Tok (วัดภูทอก) Temple - lonely mountain temple. #BuengKan #Thailand #WatPhuTok

The temple was originally founded by Ajahn Juan who loved the mountain for its dangerous wildlife such as tigers and snakes. Eventually monks build a series of shrines, and ladders, and wooden plank walkways around the rock outcrop, with seven layers. The 6th layer is the most thrilling and adventurous - there’s an entire circumference of wooden planks around the rock that are hand build and anchored into the rock. You’re around 300 meters high with nothing below you and just a wooden plank between you and falling all the way down. The 7th level just includes nature and views from the top.

Wat Phu Tok (วัดภูทอก) is without a doubt one of the most adventurous, slightly dangerous, and scary temples I’ve visited in Thailand and also one of the most beautiful and thrilling.

Highly recommended!

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

localized.title: One Slip, 300 Meter Fall!! Thailand’s Most DANGEROUS Temple! | Wat Phu Tok (วัดภูทอก), Bueng Kan
localized.description:
Wat Phu Tok (วัดภูทอก) Temple in Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ), Thailand!
🎥 Castle Rock Cove in Satun: https://youtu.be/Srm4C0NBL1E

Welcome to Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ), the ultra relaxing province in the Isaan region of Northeastern Thailand, on the Mekong River. It’s a place you can visit for relaxation, Isaan culture, and especially adventure and nature. One of the places I was most looking forward to visiting in Bueng Kan (บึงกาฬ) is a temple that’s built on and surrounding red mountain rock, called Wat Jetiyakhiri (วัดเจติยาคิรีวิหาร) or better known as Wat Phu Tok (วัดภูทอก) Temple - lonely mountain temple. #BuengKan #Thailand #WatPhuTok

The temple was originally founded by Ajahn Juan who loved the mountain for its dangerous wildlife such as tigers and snakes. Eventually monks build a series of shrines, and ladders, and wooden plank walkways around the rock outcrop, with seven layers. The 6th layer is the most thrilling and adventurous - there’s an entire circumference of wooden planks around the rock that are hand build and anchored into the rock. You’re around 300 meters high with nothing below you and just a wooden plank between you and falling all the way down. The 7th level just includes nature and views from the top.

Wat Phu Tok (วัดภูทอก) is without a doubt one of the most adventurous, slightly dangerous, and scary temples I’ve visited in Thailand and also one of the most beautiful and thrilling.

Highly recommended!

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

Srm4C0NBL1E.title: Crab Fried Rice on Private Beach + CASTLE ROCK COVE! | Prasat Hin Pun Yod (ปราสาทหินพันยอด)
Srm4C0NBL1E.description:
Prasat Hin Pun Yod (ปราสาทหินพันยอด) - Castle Rock Cove in Satun (สตูล), Thailand
🎥 Satun’s Waterfall Playground: https://youtu.be/O6xU_n5krk4

Satun (สตูล), Thailand - Welcome to Satun, in the far south of Thailand, on the border of Thailand. Satun is home to a UNESCO Global Geopark and one of the attractions I was most looking forward to visiting when I was there is Prasat Hin Pun Yod (ปราสาทหินพันยอด), translated in English to Castle Rock 1000 Sharp Rocks. It really is a fortress like rock formation in a circular shape. You have to take a kayak into the castle fortress, and depending on the tides, you’ll either have a beach, or the cove will be filled with water.

Bo Chet Luk Pier - First, you leave from Bo Chet Luk, a local fishing village community. The tours are run by the community, so it’s also great to be able to support the community through taking this tour.

The tour included the boat and guide, visiting 3 or 4 different sights, and a light lunch - today was Thai crab fried rice on a private beach.

Price - 1,000 THB ($33.12) per person, includes park entrance fee, and everything

Book the tour here (บังยู่หนา พาเที่ยว): https://www.facebook.com/bo7luk/

I thought it was an amazing day trip. The castle rock cove is spectacular and the rock formations, beaches, and water are stunning. Highly recommended when you’re in Satun.

Here are some other things to do in Satun: 
Wang Sai Thong Waterfall (น้ำตกวังสายทอง): https://youtu.be/O6xU_n5krk4

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

O6xU_n5krk4.title: Thailand’s Natural WATERFALL PLAYGROUND!! Swimming + Lunch in Satun, Thailand!
O6xU_n5krk4.description:
🌊 Wang Sai Thong Waterfall (น้ำตกวังสายทอง) - Things To Do in Satun, Thailand
🎥 Watch Next: $100 Beach Villa Paradise: https://youtu.be/4KHCU3Osx38

SATUN, THAILAND - Welcome to Satun, a beautiful province in Southern Thailand on the Andaman sea and bordering Malaysia. Along with spectacular islands, delicious food, and amazingly friendly people, Satun is home to a number of spectacular waterfalls. About an hour drive from Satun city is Wang Sai Thong Waterfall (น้ำตกวังสายทอง), a waterfall I had on my list to visit - so I was excited to finally have a chance to visit. #Satun #travelvlog #waterfall

Wang Sai Thong Waterfall (น้ำตกวังสายทอง) - Price - 200 THB ($6.60) entrance (just 20 THB for Thai citizens). Just a 100 meter walk from the parking lot and you’ll reach the beautiful waterfalls. The waterfall is not a huge drop waterfall, but it’s rather a series of cascading waterfalls and baths of water that have naturally formed. It really is a natural waterfall playground and bath tub. An amazing place to hike around, swim, and splash in the water. I really enjoyed it.

Restoran Negara - Next we drove back to Satun city, about an hour drive and went to Restoran Negara, a central restaurant and tea shop right in the heart of the city. It was Friday, so quite a few restaurants were closed in the city so we just stopped here because it was open. We ordered a number of dishes, and overall the food was alright. The roti and the teh tarik were a little sweet, but very good. Total price - 640 THB ($21.12)

And that wraps up day one in Satun, and I would highly recommend Wang Sai Thong Waterfall (น้ำตกวังสายทอง) as one of the top things to do when you’re in Satun!

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

6q-j-lkKXS8.title: Nature Paradise - $24.63 TREE HOUSE Over The River Tour!! | Phatthalung, Thailand! 🇹🇭
6q-j-lkKXS8.description:
🎥 Amazing SNAKE FRUIT Salad!: https://youtu.be/en2pYLHqY9A
🏖️ Here’s the place: https://goo.gl/maps/CgSKNKfwddBKSQ5z6

Phatthalung, Thailand - Welcome to Phatthalung, one of the most chilled out and beautiful provinces in Southern Thailand. It’s home to lakes, pristine rainforest, friendly people, and delicious food. #travel #treehouse #Thailand

One of the places I was excited to visit is called บ้านต้นไม้ ร้อยหวันนอนฟังสายน้ำ (https://goo.gl/maps/CgSKNKfwddBKSQ5z6), which roughly translates to Tree House sleep well listening to the sound of the river. Quite a name for an outstandingly amazing place. And without a doubt, you are guaranteed to be surrounded by nature - within nature - and always with the sound of the river flowing in your ears. They have a number of unique tree house accommodations. Unfortunately we were able to stay in the best tree house because it’s not so kid friendly. But I’ll give you a full tour in this video, and also of the more kid friendly room where we stayed - which was still a treet house. In addition to the supreme nature environment, the food is outstanding. The owner emphasizes local and natural food, and you can taste the freshness with every bite.

An amazing place, one of my favorite nature tree house places in Thailand. For the cost, they charge 750 THB ($24.63) per person, which includes dinner and breakfast, and the accommodation.

They also cooked a special snake fruit salad while I was there, it was Amazing! You can watch that here: https://youtu.be/en2pYLHqY9A

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

4KHCU3Osx38.title: $100 Beach Villa Paradise!! | Hidden Gem Thailand - Koh Kradan Island (เกาะกระดาน)!
4KHCU3Osx38.description:
🎥 Thailand’s Most Beautiful Lake: https://youtu.be/kx-XREZ9n7U
🏖️ Mali Resort: https://www.maliresorts.com/ (not sponsored)

Koh Kradan (เกาะกระดาน) - During my trip to Trang, in Southern Thailand, we decided to take a break from all the street food tours, and escaped to Koh Kradan (เกาะกระดาน) for a couple of days. When I was researching, I came across Mali Resort, a newly opened resort, and what attracted me was that it looked like the villas were right on the beach, ultimate beach front. And it looked quiet and peaceful, and very family friendly. So I booked it for a couple nights. #Thailand #KohKradan #Island #beach

We arranged the boat ride through the hotel, and it cost 1,000 THB. The ride took about 40 minutes, and even though it was sunny, it was very windy making for rough conditions to get to the island. We got soaked, but it was all worth it when we arrived to the pristine shores of Koh Kradan (เกาะกระดาน), an amazing hidden gem, paradise island in Trang, Thailand.

Mali Resort in Koh Kradan (เกาะกระดาน) was everything we were hoping for, peaceful, relaxing, great value, stunningly beautiful, sand, beach, and watersports all included. Amazing beach hotel, I would highly recommend it. Price - 3,000 THB per night ($96.02)

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

kx-XREZ9n7U.title: Eating Lunch at Thailand’s Most Beautiful Lake! | Cheow Lan Lake (เชี่ยวหลาน)
kx-XREZ9n7U.description:
🎥 Jungle Treehouse + Night Safari: https://youtu.be/Ei4LSFBzd5s

Cheow Lan Lake (เชี่ยวหลาน) - Located within Khao Sok National Park, Cheow Lan Lake (เชี่ยวหลาน) is a lesser visited gem of beauty in Southern Thailand. While there are a number of floating hotels within the lake, we just took a boat ride day trip, had lunch, a quick swim, and headed back to shore. #AmazingThailand #SuratThani

You can arrange a full package tour of Cheow Lan Lake (เชี่ยวหลาน) from any of the surrounding hotels or lodges - and to be honest I think it might be worth it with less hassle. But alternatively, you can just show up at the pier like I did. To take a boat you’ll need to get to Ratchaprapha Marina (ท่าเรือเทศบาล เขื่อนเชี่ยวหลาน). For our private boat it cost 2,500 THB ($80) and additionally there’s a Thai national park entrance fee of 320 THB ($10.24).

Cheow Lan Lake (เชี่ยวหลาน) is incredibly beautiful, stunning water and mountain formations. I would highly recommend visiting when you are at Khao Sok National Park in Surat Thani, Thailand.

NOTE: You take the boat from Ratchaprapha Marina (ท่าเรือเทศบาล เขื่อนเชี่ยวหลาน https://goo.gl/maps/mccMRUEyAEU122D76) which is about an hour drive from Khao Sok National Park (even though it’s part of Khao Sok National Park).

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

seakQDE1jwU.title: We Took a Boat Through an AMAZING MANGROVE TUNNEL! | Pattani (ปัตตานี), Thailand!
seakQDE1jwU.description:
🎥 Day 1 in Pattani: https://youtu.be/fv2N3MUiPHo
📺 Yaseen’s channel: https://youtu.be/J4Zv36D6cCs

PATTANI, THAILAND (ปัตตานี) - One of the attractions I was looking forward to visiting in Pattani is known as Bang Pu (ชุมชนท่องเที่ยวบางปู), known for its amazing mangrove forest where you can take a boat through a spectacular mangrove tunnel. What I also love is that it’s a community tourism initiative, run and operated by the local community in the area. #AmazingThailand #Pattani #travel

The boat costs just 500 THB for the journey, and then we also tipped our captain. First we glided through the mangrove tunnels. The nature is pristine and beautiful, and so untouched. It truly is an unseen attraction of Thailand and beautiful to visit.

Lastly, we headed out to the open sea - although this area of the sea is still sheltered by the cape - to a small mud bank to watch the sunset. Amazing view, peace and quiet, and a wonderful attraction to visit when you are in Pattani, Thailand.

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

fv2N3MUiPHo.description:
🎥 Huge Arabian Thai Food: https://youtu.be/O8bieTQXThc

PATTANI, THAILAND (ปัตตานี) - After a huge Arabian Thai feast at Papa Tagu (https://goo.gl/maps/QHRZHZLB3hpabRSx7), we headed out for Day 1 in Pattani. I was excited to explore and I was blown away by the kindness of people, historical attractions, the delicious street food snacks, and the amazing natural beauty. 

Here are the things we did in this Pattani travel guide video:

Pattani salt - first we visited a community that produces Pattani salt, known throughout Thailand as one of the best sea salts.

Krue Se Mosque - Welcome to the oldest mosque in Thailand, known for its brick construction and arches. It was built with Middle East and European styles in the 16th century.

Yaring City - On the way to the cape we stopped for some Malay street food sweets in Yaring City.

Laem Tachi (Tachi Cape) - One of the highlights of today was driving all the way to the tip of Laem Tachi (Tachi Cape) for sun set, spectacular.

Pattani Central Mosque - Finally, to end this tour of Pattani on Day 1, we stopped at the amazing Pattani Central Mosque at night.

Again, the people, the Malay culture, street food snacks were wonderful and it was an honor to have a chance to visit Pattani, South Thailand.

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

Ei4LSFBzd5s.title: Jungle Treehouse Tour + Night Safari!! | Khao Sok National Park | Our Jungle Camp
Ei4LSFBzd5s.description:
🎥 Dome Tent in Chiang Mai: https://youtu.be/yYs4H_PS-dk
🏡 Our Jungle Camp - Khao Sok: https://www.khaosokecoresort.com/

Welcome to Khao Sok National Park, located in the Southern Thailand province of Surat Thani. It’s one of the world’s oldest rainforests, and one of my favorite places to visit in Thailand. A combination of the incredible ancient rainforest ecosystem and the karst mountain landscape make it spectacular. #Thailand #KhaoSok #jungle

On this trip to Khao Sok National Park, my family and I stayed at Our Jungle Camp, an eco lodge with wooden stilt tree houses, surrounded by beautiful jungle. It’s a great place to stay, highly recommended. In this video I’ll first give you a tour of our tree house, and then in the evening I signed up to go on a walking night safari in the jungle.

Although walking through the jungle at night was kind of scary, it was so cool and a totally different perspective from day light. You can really hear the sounds of the rainforest, the crickets, and drips of rain, and leaves. It was a great experience, and we were lucky to see a loris, three snakes, lots of bats, a tarantula, and finally a couple of flying fox at the end.

Here’s how much I paid:

Our Jungle Camp - Khao Sok, Thailand
Tree house - 1,560 THB ($50) per night
Night safari - 640 THB ($20.51) per person

Our Jungle Camp (https://www.khaosokecoresort.com/), I really enjoyed my stay with them, and especially this amazing experience.

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

DjO2rWwvGbw.title: Northern Thai Food - Best Restaurants in Chiang Mai! | Huen Jai Yong (เฮือนใจ๋ยอง)
DjO2rWwvGbw.description:
🎥 Hmong Food in Chiang Mai: https://youtu.be/EbJzKMZJaEc
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z
🌾 Huen Jai Yong (เฮือนใจ๋ยอง): https://goo.gl/maps/ik3dpTTazMcyDuDv8

Huen Jai Yong (เฮือนใจ๋ยอง) - A few years ago, when Ying and I were in Chiang Mai, Thailand, we ate at Huen Jai Yong (เฮือนใจ๋ยอง) and were impressed with the taste of the Northern Thai food and the amazing antique filled atmosphere. On this trip to Chiang Mai, we were still craving the delicious food, and so we went there again this time for lunch.

The menu is a full checklist including a couple dozen Northern Thai dishes that you can choose from.

Here’s what we ordered:

Gai neung (ไก่เมืองนึ่งสมุนไพร)
Gaeng hanglay (แกงฮังเล)
Khua ho (คั่วโฮ๊ะ)
Nam prik noom (น้ำพริกนุ่ม)
Saa pak gad noi (ส้าผักกาดน้อย)
Gaeng khae (แกงแค)
Tam khanun (ตำขนุน)

Total price - 670 THB ($21.35)

While you can’t go wrong and just about everything you order will be delicious, I’m particularly in love with their Gai neung (ไก่เมืองนึ่งสมุนไพร), chicken in a huge amount of herbs and fresh spices, then steamed. It’s sensational.

I think what stands out to me about the food at Huen Jai Yong (เฮือนใจ๋ยอง) is that everything is solidly good, it’s reliable, and a great family restaurant, and I think overall it’s one of the best Northern Thai food restaurants in Chiang Mai - that I’ve tried.

Next time you’re in Chiang Mai, go check it out for authentic northern Thai food. It’s about a 15 minute drive from the center of the city.

Thank you for watching, hope you’re having a fantastic day!

yYs4H_PS-dk.title: We Stayed in an IGLOO DOME TENT in Thailand’s Mountains! | Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม)
yYs4H_PS-dk.description:
🎥 Day Trip to Mon Jam: https://youtu.be/EbJzKMZJaEc
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z
🌾 Ozone House (บ้านโอโซน ม่อนแจ่ม): https://goo.gl/maps/w1TP319zJvUTpGhM9

Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม) is a beautiful mountain top village just a 45 minute drive away from Chiang Mai city, in Northern Thailand. We originally went there on a day trip and saw the accommodation options, and then we decided to return to spend the night.

There are many accommodation options, from luxury dome tents to basic dome tents to all sorts of cabins and bungalow styles. We chose a nice family run lodge called Ozone House - Mon Jam (บ้านโอโซน ม่อนแจ่ม https://goo.gl/maps/w1TP319zJvUTpGhM9). The Hmong family that owned and ran it, were extremely friendly - they even cooked us an outstanding Hmong meal, which you can watch here: https://youtu.be/Lk3HXqYlqFI

Our Igloo shaped dome tent was basic but nice, including our own private platform overlooking a panoramic view of the mountains and village of Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม). It also came with a private bathroom, though outside of the dome tent, but on our own platform. Our evening was fantastic and relaxing, full of fresh cool air and an escape from the city life.

My family really enjoyed our stay in Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม), and highly recommended to get some fresh air and enjoy the beautiful mountain views and terraced farming. Additionally, it’s so close to Chiang Mai city.
 
Price - I paid 1,090 THB ($34.99) per night

Thank you for watching, hope you’re having a fantastic day!

EbJzKMZJaEc.title: Hmong Food in Thailand!! Day Trip to Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม) Mountain Village! | Chiang Mai
EbJzKMZJaEc.description:
🎥 Giant Breakfast at Home-stay: https://youtu.be/nCrtf6ZjG7w
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z
Joel’s Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrtRLTcGy-CPac-JwMuuHgQ

Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม) - Located just an hour from Chiang Mai city, Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม) is an amazing mountain village known as Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม), which is predominantly home to a Hmong community. One day, along with my friend Joel, we decided to take a drive to Mon Jam, enjoy some amazing scenery, fresh air, and delicious local Hmong Food from the mountains. #Thailand #travel #Hmong

We started off, and first enjoyed the amazing views and viewpoints once we arrived. Then we headed to the market to walk around. First we bought some fruit - they have a great selection of less tropical, and more fruits that need elevation and cooler weather to grow - like melons, citrus, and egg fruit. Fruit was incredible.

Located at the Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม) market, we went to check out a restaurant in the parking lot. The ladies were extremely friendly, and we asked if they could cook us a local off-menu Hmong meal. They cooked an incredible selection of local dishes, including plenty of vegetables from the mountain, a chicken soup, and probably my favorite dish - a chili dip with lemongrass, chilies, and herbs to eat with blanched vegetables.

Total price - 440 THB ($14.03) including a few dishes not shown in the video

Di BOSCO Coffee Specialist (https://goo.gl/maps/LTxY9W1F12sRXEGeA) - One they was back to Chiang Mai, we stopped at Di BOSCO Coffee Specialist, what is easily one of the best coffee shops in Thailand. The atmosphere, the location, and the coffee are all superb.

Samoeng (สะเมิง) - We took the long way to drive back to Chiang Mai, also so that we could have a circular route. Along the way back, we stopped quickly in Samoeng (สะเมิง) and visited the local market.

Visiting Mon Jam (ม่อนแจ่ม) makes a great day trip from Chiang Mai - offering fantastic views of the mountains, and some delicious local home-cooked food.

Thank you for watching, hope you’re having a fantastic day!

Ban Na Ton Chan (บ้านนาต้นจั่น) - During our visit to Sukhothai, Thailand, we had an opportunity to stay for a night at Ban Na Ton Chan (บ้านนาต้นจั่น), an amazing village community with a fantastic home-stay program. There are more than twenty different families that have opened their homes. #Sukhothai #Thailand #ThaiFood

In this video I’ll walk you through our homestay, the room and accommodation we stayed at, and the amazing breakfast that Aunty prepared for us. We had an amazing time, my entire family and I loved the accommodation, the beautiful wooden house, the delicious food, and especially our host - Aunty - who took amazing care for us.

Highly recommended - Ban Na Ton Chan (บ้านนาต้นจั่น) is an amazing community and a great place to learn more about traditional Thai culture, stay in a wooden house, eat natural organic Thai food, and enjoy nature.

Sukhothai (สุโขทัย) Ban Na Ton Chan (บ้านนาต้นจั่น) โฮมสเตย์บ้านนาต้นจั่น : https://goo.gl/maps/6Yw6DXwkPPoAACEHA

Tj_TvpUwD-8.title: Amazing Hotel in Sukhothai, Thailand - $80 Per Night - Tour + Breakfast! | Sriwilai Hotel
Tj_TvpUwD-8.description:
🎥 Day 1 in Sukhothai: https://youtu.be/434OwY45mFo
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z

Sriwilai Sukhothai Resort & Spa - During our trip to Sukhothai, Thailand, we stayed for a couple nights at Sriwilai Sukhothai Resort & Spa hotel, an amazing boutique and charming hotel in Sukhothai, Thailand. #Sukhothai #Thailand #travel

Sukhothai was the capital of the ancient Kingdom of Siam and it has immense history. The hotel is located a couple kilometers from the entrance of the official historical park, but there’s even some ruins right next to the hotel. The Siamese Kingdom stretched far over a large area, and so there are some ancient temples and stupas right next to the hotel. I loved the setting, the local Sukhothai Thai architecture, and the views of the palmyra palm trees and rice paddy fields from the rooms and the swimming pool.

Without a doubt, one of the highlights of your stay at Sriwilai Sukhothai Resort & Spa in Sukhothai will be the swimming pool, which is huge, and overlooks the fields and some ruins. An incredibly nice setting and atmosphere!

Finally, to end this hotel tour, we went to breakfast in the morning. Breakfast was good, but simple. I did really like the display, served on a traditional khantoke style basket to eat from. I'm not sure if they would normally have had a buffet - but we stayed after the lockdown, so there were some different safety measured in place.

Overall, we had an amazing stay at the hotel, loved the room, the swimming pool, and the spectacular atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Price - We paid 2,500 THB ($80.88) per night, including breakfast - This was a bit of a special deal though I believe because the hotel had recently re-opened after the lockdown. I think this was a very good value.

Thank you for watching and hope you can visit Sukhothai (สุโขทัย)!

434OwY45mFo.title: Day 1 in Sukhothai, Thailand - Dinner in Old Wooden House!
434OwY45mFo.description:
🎥 Thailand’s Paradise Island - Koh Surin: https://youtu.be/SnKHJBjIn3I
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z

Sukhothai (สุโขทัย), is the Ancient capital city of Siam, a city that’s packed with history. I was excited to visit, and this was my first trip to Sukhothai. We arrived in the late afternoon from Bangkok after about a 5 hour drive. We checked into Sriwilai Hotel (tour coming up soon), really amazing hotel, highly recommended. Had a quick swim and then headed out for dinner. #Thailand #Sukhothai

There was a restaurant we were trying to go to eat at in the center of Sukhothai new city, but they were closed, so we headed back to the old city and went to a restaurant called Sureerat Restaurant (ร้านอาหารสุรีรัตน์โภชนา). Turned out to be a great restaurant, in an old wooden house, situated right across the street from the market, and within the old city of Sukhothai.

Here are the dishes we tried:

Jungle curry beef (แกงป่าเนื้อ)
Mixed vegetables (ผัดผักรวม)
Fried egg salad (ยำไข่ดาว)
Fried fish (ปลาทับทิมทอด)

Total price - 450 THB ($14.54)

Sureerat Restaurant (ร้านอาหารสุรีรัตน์โภชนา): https://goo.gl/maps/RhJyv3UqRqz7gP6y5

I loved my first impression of Sukhothai, laid back and charming. In later videos, you’ll get a full hotel tour, and a main street food and Sukhothai attractions tour on my main channel.

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

6n8txCsZ8hQ.title: Eating a POMFRET STEAMBOAT! Thai Chinese Food in Surat Thani, Thailand!
6n8txCsZ8hQ.description:
🎥 Thailand’s Paradise Island - Koh Surin: https://youtu.be/SnKHJBjIn3I
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z

SURAT THANI, THAILAND - One day for lunch, when we weren’t filming a full street food tour video, I wanted to have a leisure family lunch at an old Thai Chinese food restaurant in Surat Thani, called Soon Hiang Restaurant (ร้านอาหารทะเล ซุ่นเฮียง). #hotpot #Thailand #SuratThani

I loved the look of the old restaurant, with retro and original decor. From the tables to the floor and the decoration, absolutely classic. We had a chance to talk with the owner and chef, from the restaurant's family, who was very friendly and explained that his food was Teochew Chinese style.

Among the Thai Chinese Teochew dishes you can order, just about everyone who eats at Soon Hiang Restaurant (ร้านอาหารทะเล ซุ่นเฮียง) must get the pomfret steamboat (also known as a charcoal hot pot). It was delicious, simple, and I love pomfret - every chance I get to eat it, I love it.

In addition to the pomfret hot pot, what really stood out to me was the sauce used for the fish which was a perfect combination of fermented soy bean sauce, some kind of acidity, and ginger for flavor.

Awesome restaurant, classic style, and delicious pomfret steamboat!

Total price - 1,450 THB (44.77 USD)

Soon Hiang Restaurant (ร้านอาหารทะเล ซุ่นเฮียง): https://goo.gl/maps/C8PCWfGvJhNcpQgw6

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

7rP21A8nBOQ.title: Jungle Bungalow!! $50 Eco-Lodge in Thailand - FULL TOUR! | Khao Sok National Park!
7rP21A8nBOQ.description:
🎥 Thailand’s Paradise Island - Koh Surin: https://youtu.be/SnKHJBjIn3I
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z

Surat Thani (สุราษฎร์ธานี) - On our trip to Surat Thani, we visited Khao Sok, and stayed at a very cool Thai eco lodge called Anurak Community Lodge (https://goo.gl/maps/riYf5huh6rrzaFgc8). Here’s a full review of the lodge and the surrounding area. #Thailand #KhaoSok #ecolodge #hotel

Anurak Community Lodge - I love the located and the area, surrounded by jagged mountains and within a grove of palm oil trees. All the rooms are named after Thai fruits, and each room is built on stilts above ground to protest from the elements and animals - probably! Rooms are basic, but very clean, and eco friendly. The bathroom is open air on the side of the room so you can hear the jungle. However, the room has AC.

Breakfast was ok, not fantastic, but the coffee was pleasantly great from Chiang Mai. The staff were fantastic, very helpful and friendly. They can also help to arrange any activities you may want to do in Khao Sok National Park.

Price - We paid $50 per night. We had a great say at Anurak Community Lodge and would recommend it!

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

_ikwNz7j8zE.title: Visiting an ISLAND VILLAGE - Moken Sea Nomads of Thailand!! หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์
_ikwNz7j8zE.description:
🎥 Thailand’s Paradise Island - Koh Surin: https://youtu.be/SnKHJBjIn3I
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z

Koh Surin (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์) - One of the reasons I was very interested to visit Koh Surin (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์) island in Thailand is not only because it’s a gorgeous National Park, but also because it’s home to the Moken people - a sea nomadic community - experts of the ocean. So in the afternoon, we headed over to the village on the island, and it was an honor to walk around, and learn about the Moken people and their amazing culture. #Thailand #Andaman #island

Moken - or people of the sea - traditionally live in the Andaman sea islands around Thailand and Myanmar. Traditionally, Moken people would live partly from their boats, and partly on ground. But eventually this community settled on Koh Surin, forming a village.

One of the amazing things about the Moken is their acute knowledge of the sea. During the devastating tsunami in the Indian ocean in 2004, the elders of this village knew something as different, and they instructed everyone to climb to higher ground. Though the village was destroyed everyone from the village survived. It’s this sense of nature and the world that makes the Moken so special.

Though it was a short visit, it was interesting and a privilege to learn a little about the Moken people on Koh Surin (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์) island.

If you haven’t seen my other Koh Surin (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์) national park island tour, you can watch it here: https://youtu.be/SnKHJBjIn3I

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

SnKHJBjIn3I.title: Trip to PARADISE ISLAND in Thailand!! 🏝️ Koh Surin National Park (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์)
SnKHJBjIn3I.description:
🎥 Chef’s Table Food Delivery: https://youtu.be/MoGj14GqJDU
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z

Koh Surin (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์) - In March 2020, we spent about a week in the Southern Thailand province on Phang Nga - I absolutely loved it - from the food to the people to the natural scenery and beaches. We decided to go to Koh Surin (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์), a national park island, known to be one of the most pristine islands in Thailand. And since it wasn’t as busy with tourism as it typically is, we were able to get a booking at the National Park lodge on the island. In this video I’ll share this entire experience of getting to Koh Surin, and staying in the bungalows.

Greenview Tour Speedboat -  1,700 THB ($52.44) per person, roundtrip - First you must get to Koh Surin (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์) island, and the fastest way to get there is by speed boat which takes about 1 hour 10 minutes. The boat left from Khura Buri (คุระบุรี) pier, in Phang Nga province. The boat ride was surprisingly smooth and we arrived to the island, to the amazingly pure and clear waters of the islands.

Buffet lunch - 750 THB ($23.13) per person - There aren’t too many food options - or let me say, no food options other than the National Park headquarters canteen. But you can choose to order from the menu, or you can eat the buffet that lots of snorkeling trips eat on day trip to the island. Since the buffet was ready and we were really hungry, we just ate the buffet. It’s not the greatest Thai food you’ll eat, but it was ok.

Bungalow Price - 2,000 THB ($61.69) per night - Bungalows are basic, but comfortable, with AC and self contained. I thought they were great.

The best things for me about staying at the bungalow overnight is that Koh Surin (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์) can be busy during the day because most people take day trips to the island, but head back to mainly by 3 or 4 pm. So being there after hours, it was so quiet, so peaceful, and so relaxing. That was the best.

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

The boat left from Khura Buri (คุระบุรี) pier, in Phang Nga province. The boat ride was surprisingly smooth and we arrived to the island, to the amazingly pure and clear waters of the islands.

Buffet lunch - 750 THB ($23.13) per person - There aren’t too many food options - or let me say, no food options other than the National Park headquarters canteen. But you can choose to order from the menu, or you can eat the buffet that lots of snorkeling trips eat on day trip to the island. Since the buffet was ready and we were really hungry, we just ate the buffet. It’s not the greatest Thai food you’ll eat, but it was ok.

Bungalow Price - 2,000 THB ($61.69) per night - Bungalows are basic, but comfortable, with AC and self contained. I thought they were great.

The best things for me about staying at the bungalow overnight is that Koh Surin (หมู่เกาะสุรินทร์) can be busy during the day because most people take day trips to the island, but head back to mainly by 3 or 4 pm. So being there after hours, it was so quiet, so peaceful, and so relaxing. That was the best.

Thank you for watching and hope you’re having a fantastic day!

G4Yt8BWePNg.title: AMAZING POOL ROOM Hotel in Pattaya!! 🇹🇭 Thailand Tourism Re-Opening!
G4Yt8BWePNg.description:
🎥 Chef’s Table Food Delivery: https://youtu.be/MoGj14GqJDU
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z
 
As of recently Thailand has re-opened most businesses, restaurants, malls, and now hotels. So my wife, son, and I wanted to get away from Bangkok for a day. We drove just south of Bangkok about 1.5 hours to Pattaya, a famous seaside city in Thailand. Just south of Pattaya, but still considered part of Pattaya is Bang Saray (บางเสร่), much more quiet and relaxed than the center of Pattaya. #Pattaya #Thailand #hotel
 
Bang Saray Seafood (ร้านอาหาร บางเสร่ ซีฟู้ด) - But first things - before checking into the hotel, we stopped for some Thai food at Bang Saray Seafood (ร้านอาหาร บางเสร่ ซีฟู้ด). The restaurant was nice, overlooking the pier and fishing boats. 
 
Kept Bang Saray Hotel Pattaya (https://g.page/keptbangsaray?share) - My wife booked this hotel for one night, I didn’t even know anything about it before arriving. Turned out to be a great small boutique hotel, right along the water. Staff were friendly and helpful, there were plenty of social distancing and hygiene measures in place. And she booked the room with a private swimming pool overlooking the hotel. It was quite a cool room, and we had a lot of fun splashing around in the water. Breakfast in the morning was also great, a buffet with vegetables, and a full array of pre-cooked Thai food in the morning. One things to note about this hotel in Pattaya is that it’s on the sea, but it’s not really a swimming beach. Price - 7,300 THB ($231.51) per night, for the room we had. There are other room options as well.
 
It was a great short trip, and nice to get out of Bangkok with hotels re-opening and tourism opening back up domestically in Thailand.
 
Hope you’re doing well and keeping safe!

https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

dVq23r3g1nY.title: Chinatown in Budapest, Hungary 🇭🇺 Best Chinese Food I’ve Eaten in Europe!
dVq23r3g1nY.description:
🎥 Chef’s Table Food Delivery: https://youtu.be/MoGj14GqJDU
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z

I had read about Budapest having one of the best Chinatown’s and largest Chinese populations in Europe, and so I was excited to visit Chinatown Budapest, and especially to eat Chinese food. #Budapest #Hungary #ChineseFood

We had been traveling in Europe already for about a month and I was ready and excited to eat Chinese food!

From the riverside area of Budapest we took a taxi directly to Chinatown - actually directly to a Chinese restaurant I wanted to eat at. Chinatown is about 5 km from the center of the city. What surprised me about Chinatown Budapest is that it’s very industrial - sprawling markets and warehouses, importers and exporters. And then there’s plenty of Chinese restaurants everywhere you look.

Hehe Chinese Restaurant - We headed straight to Hehe Chinese restaurant, a well established Chinese food restaurant in Budapest. They had a takeaway food counter with prepared food - just like in China - and they had a full menu. Their bowls of noodles looked really good. But we ordered from the menu, mapo tofu, cabbage with pork, hot and sour soup, and a Sichuan style fried chicken with chilies. The food was delicious, even better than I had imagined or thought it would be. The taste of the food was just like being in China. The total price for our meal came to 9,100 HUF ($27.75 USD).

It was great to visit Chinatown in Budapest, Hungary, and especially to have Chinese food. For me, it was the best Chinese food I’ve ever eaten in Europe.

https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

8u2HqbhdY18.title: Tuk Tuk Thai Food Delivery 🛺 !! Market to Table Meal in Bangkok, Thailand!
8u2HqbhdY18.description:
🎥 Chef’s Table Food Delivery: https://youtu.be/MoGj14GqJDU
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z
💐Market Food Experience: https://www.marketexperiences.com/
 
During this time in the world, among the many industries affected, have been the entire tourism sector. And without any tourists, tour companies offering tours have had to come up with new ideas and ways to earn a living to support staff and community. #withme #ThaiFood #Bangkok
 
I’ve known Simon from https://www.expique.com/ for many years, and he messaged me saying they started doing market meal experiences, delivery to your house in Bangkok, by tuk tuk. I thought it was a pretty cool idea, and great way to support the community. Additionally, for every meal bought, they also donate a meal in the community. I thought it would be great to support this project and I personally ordered a meal for 2, plus some extras. My total price came to 1,800 THB for everything.
 
I had no idea Simon was going to show up in the tuk tuk as well! Since the food and experience all came from Bangkok’s central flower market, meal came decorated with plenty of flowers, all packed into a pinto. Rice at the bottom, and chicken pumpkin massaman curry, sweet chicken salad, and pad cha style barramundi. The meal kit also included a mocktail drink, snacks like kaprao samosas, and a range of Thai desserts.
 
Thai meal was great, and some of it was sourced from vendors at the market while other dishes were cooked by staff. 
 
I thought it was a great meal, and could be fun for an entire family. If you’re in Bangkok and interested, you can get more details here: https://www.marketexperiences.com/
 
Thank you for watching, and hope you’re having an amazing day, and keeping safe.

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

MoGj14GqJDU.title: Chef’s Table Delivery 🛵 Amazing Thai + Korean Food 🇹🇭🇰🇷 in Bangkok, Thailand!
MoGj14GqJDU.description:
🍽️ Samrub Samrub Thai สำรับสำหรับไทย: https://www.instagram.com/samrubsamrubthai/
🎥 World’s Best Vegetarian Food: https://youtu.be/eEN4PqP7lno
👍 100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z
 
Organized by Fruitfull.co (https://fruitfull.co/) - It was an honor to have a chance to experience a new concept in Chef’s Table dining in Bangkok, Thailand - where you have a gourmet meal delivered to your doorstep by motorbike, and full livestream with the Chef’s and stories behind the ingredients and live music - all to accompany your meal at home.  #withme #ThaiFood #Bangkok
 
Samrub Samrub Thai สำรับสำหรับไทย - Without a doubt, one of my favorite restaurants in the world. You can see my full video eating at Samrub Samrub Thai สำรับสำหรับไทย here: https://youtu.be/s_Vro4RV52Q Thanks to Chef Prin (https://www.instagram.com/prinpolsuk/) and Khun Mint (https://www.instagram.com/goodmorningmint/).
 
Chef Cho Hee-sook (https://www.instagram.com/hansikgonggan/) from Hansik Gonggan in Seoul, South Korea - Along with Samrub Samrub Thai สำรับสำหรับไทย, this meal was a collaboration with the amazing Chef Cho Hee-sook. She joined in the livestream from Seoul.
 
While eating, we could interact and hear from the Chef’s and their ideas behind the food, and there was a full program of tours, cooking demonstrations, and live music. I thought it was an amazing concept, and a model for a Chef’s Table dining experience at home in Bangkok, Thailand.
 
Thank you for the amazing meal experience!
