Yt9K1iXePKc.title: Durian Fruit in Thailand 🇹🇭- Trying 8 Different Varieties of the World’s Best Fruit!!
Yt9K1iXePKc.description:
🎥World’s Best Vegetarian Food: https://youtu.be/eEN4PqP7lno
👍100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z
 
Durian fruit ทุเรียน - Since the first time I tasted durian in 2009 in Malaysia, it was love at first taste - I fell in love with the beautiful sweet and creamy texture of the Durian - the King of Fruits. Along with being by far the coolest looking and spiky fruit in the world, the flesh is unlike any thing else in the world. And there are countless varieties of durian - in Thailand alone there something like 200 - 300. I prefer the stronger tasting durians, like in Malaysia and Indonesia, and Southern Thailand - bitter, sweet, and complex.

#Durian #WithMe #Bangkok #fruit
 
Since we’re at home in Bangkok, Thailand, and it’s durian season in Thailand, my wife Ying went on a durian ordering spree, I think we had at least 15 durians delivered by mail to our house. So I decided to make a video testing all eight of these different Thai durian varieties - each different and unique in shape and feel.
 
Here are the Thai durians we tried:
 
Puang Manee Jiw พวงมณีจิ๋ว
Puang Manee พวงมณี
Mon Thong หมอนทอง
Kradum กระดุม
Chanee ชะนี
Kob Chai Nam กบชายน้ำ
Nok Yib นกหยิบ
Kan Yao ก้านยาว

Hard to say which one was my favorite, but I loved the Kradum กระดุม and the Puang Manee พวงมณี.

Thank you for watching, and hope you love eating durian fruit as much as I do!

Thank you for watching, and hope you’re having an amazing day.

https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

Along with being by far the coolest looking and spiky fruit in the world, the flesh is unlike any thing else in the world. And there are countless varieties of durian - in Thailand alone there something like 200 - 300. I prefer the stronger tasting durians, like in Malaysia and Indonesia, and Southern Thailand - bitter, sweet, and complex.

#Durian #WithMe #Bangkok #fruit
 
Since we’re at home in Bangkok, Thailand, and it’s durian season in Thailand, my wife Ying went on a durian ordering spree, I think we had at least 15 durians delivered by mail to our house. So I decided to make a video testing all eight of these different Thai durian varieties - each different and unique in shape and feel.
 
Here are the Thai durians we tried:
 
Puang Manee Jiw พวงมณีจิ๋ว
Puang Manee พวงมณี
Mon Thong หมอนทอง
Kradum กระดุม
Chanee ชะนี
Kob Chai Nam กบชายน้ำ
Nok Yib นกหยิบ
Kan Yao ก้านยาว

Hard to say which one was my favorite, but I loved the Kradum กระดุม and the Puang Manee พวงมณี.

Thank you for watching, and hope you love eating durian fruit as much as I do!

Thank you for watching, and hope you’re having an amazing day.

a6F4vuYPpi8.title: Jamaica Road Trip 🚗🇯🇲 JAMAICAN BOX LUNCH - Food and Driving Tour!
a6F4vuYPpi8.description:
🎥Living in Jamaica: https://youtu.be/G4CVdqF2jBQ
👍100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: http://pixelfy.me/uY4K5z

On this Jamaican road trip, we started off in the morning in Montego Bay, and drove all the way along the North Coast of Jamaica, ending our day past Port Antonio. Along the way, we stopped to eat some amazing Jamaican food along the way - a Jamaican food road trip. #Jamaica #JamaicanFood #OchoRios

Puddin Man - One of the places we wanted to stop is Pudding Man - they make a type of cake using a fire and charcoal. We got the classic pumpkin. It was great, rich and sweet. Price - 200 JMD ($1.45)

Ocho Rios - In Ocho Rios, we stopped for lunch, and this time at Soldiers Restaurant for a classic Jamaican box lunch where you choose the dishes you want, and they are all filled into a box to good. Food was home-cooked and delicious! Price - About 700 JMD ($5.07)

G & B Jerk Centre - Finally, another stop on this Jamaica road trip was at G & B Jerk Centre that a couple friends had recommended. It was amazing, so good. To be honest we tried some of the jerk at Boston Bay as well, but this I thought was better and fresher. Price - 500 JMD ($3.62) per ¼ lb.

Port Antonio - After about 5 hours and many Jamaican food stops along the way, we arrived to Port Antonio. We actually continued on past Port Antonio to spend the night.

It was another great day in Jamaica and a wonderful road trip!

Welcome to Montego Bay, Jamaica! During our trip there, filming videos about Jamaican food and culture, we rented an apartment right near the beach in Montego Bay. In this video, I’ll give you a full tour of our two bedroom apartment, and also do some walking around the area. The apartment was located in a little bit of a tourist main area of Montego Bay, but with plenty of small shops and restaurants around. Location was ideal. #Jamaica #MontegoBay #travel

The day before we filmed this apartment tour, we had met up with Mark and Sky while eating Jamaican jerk bbq. We figured out we were staying right next to their office at Island Routes - and so the next morning, they invited us over to their office to hang out, have coffee and some unique Jamaican snacks. Great place in Montego Bay, and we had an amazing time in Jamaica.

EeKqSJoj9Ig.title: Legendary Jamaican Food!! 🇯🇲 Suckling Roast Pig in Lamb’s River, Jamaica!
EeKqSJoj9Ig.description:
🙏Thanks to Matt Robinson: https://www.instagram.com/jamaicafoodboss/
🎥Late Night Street Food in Iran: https://youtu.be/V5-0KeNpjEo
👍100% Real Durian Chips - Order Here: https://amzn.to/2RdmD5q

Lamb’s River, Jamaica - About a 45 minute drive into the mountains from Montego Bay is the very small village of Lamb’s River, Jamaica. It really is the countryside. But their legendary Lamb’s River roast suckling pig, stuffed with jerk rice, is what has put this small village on the map. #Jamaica #JamaicanFood #Caribbean

Along with Matt (https://www.instagram.com/jamaicafoodboss/), one Saturday afternoon, we decided to drive to Lamb’s River for a taste of this amazing Jamaican food.

They only serve it on Saturdays, and you have to be there right on time, or you’ll miss out - they sell out quickly. Most regulars are there as they arrive. The amazing family has been roasting suckling pigs like this for generations, and they continue to cook and serve in the same manner. The pig is unloaded, and immediately you start order and they dish it out. You order by the pound - a foil wrapper of fresh home-style roast suckling pig, with extremely crispy skin, with a scoop of jerk rice which is cooked inside the pig.

You can taste the fruitiness of the scotch bonnet peppers and the sweetness of the allspice berries, paired with the meaty deliciousness of the roast pig. And that skin!

Friends in the video:
Matt Robinson: https://www.instagram.com/jamaicafoodboss/
Joel: https://www.instagram.com/kru_joel/

ISFAHAN, IRAN - Located in one of Iran’s most significant and historical cities, Abbasi Hotel is one of the oldest continually running hotels, and a piece of Persian luxury. It’s an incredible historical hotel, with Persian gardens, secret luxury meeting rooms, and amazing dining. #Isfahan #Iran #hotels

During our trip to Isfahan, we had the privilege to stay at Abbasi Hotel, and in this video I’m giving you a full tour of our room, the Persian gardens, an amazing Iranian breakfast, and finally, we had a private tour of some of the VIP rooms and secret halls of the hotel.

Abbasi Hotel is without a doubt one of the most unique hotels in the world, and an icon of luxury and history in Iran. Highly recommended when you are in Isfahan, Iran.

X4F7RNUtf7I.title: Persepolis - 500 BC Persian Empire + Iranian Truck-Stop Lunch! | Iran 🇮🇷
X4F7RNUtf7I.description:
🎥5-Star Hotel Tour in Iran: https://youtu.be/Rmo2Mtd-JSo
😃Follow Mr. Taster: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheMrtaster/
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

Persepolis - Better known locally as Takht-e Jamshid, was the capital of the ancient  Achaemenid Empire of Persia. Cyrus the Great, Darius, and Xerxes, were all involved with the building and development of Persepolis. With immense history and importance, I was excited to have a chance to visit during our trip to Iran. #Iran #IranianFood #Persia #Persepoli

Although most of the Persepolis city is now in ruins, destroyed by a variety of reasons, what remains tells a story and is a reminder of the might of Ancient Persia. What I especially enjoyed were the detailed rock carvings, showing stories of wars and triumph from the cultures and people. Truly a must visit destinations when you are visiting Iran.

Mohamad Restaurant - After visiting Persepolis, we then headed to Mohamad Restaurant, what is an Iranian food restaurant especially popular among truck drivers. It was my kind of place, laid back ambiance, chilled out space, and delicious local food.

Here are the main dishes we ordered:

Gheimeh - split pea stew
Akbar Joojeh - fried chicken, pomegranate sauce
Salad Shirazi - Persian cucumber salad
Kalam Polo - Cabbage rice

Another great day, amazing people, and delicious food in Iran!

Thank you to Ghasr Setareh (https://www.instagram.com/ghasr_setareh/) for arranging our trip to Iran.

V5-0KeNpjEo.title: Late Night Street Food in Shiraz, Iran 🇮🇷!! Chicken Wings BBQ 🍗!
V5-0KeNpjEo.description:
🎥5-Star Hotel Tour in Iran: https://youtu.be/Rmo2Mtd-JSo

Shiraz, Iran - We arrived at night to Shiraz, and we were going to call it an early night to rest for the next day. However, the next day, the Shiraz bazaar would be closed, so Alijan (Persia Tour Guide: https://www.instagram.com/persiatourguide/) and I quickly headed out to get a glimpse of the bazaar. It was closing, but we were still able to get in and enjoy some sights and sounds.

We were fortunate to meet some cool people along the way, and we were able to visit the gardens within the bazaar.

After the bazaar and getting some first impressions of Shiraz, we then decided to walk back to our hotel. But along the way, we stumbled into a market - and all of a sudden we were hungry. Chickpeas were delicious. But the real highlight were chicken wings kebabs, grilled fresh over hot charcoal.

#Shiraz #Iran #IranianFood #streetfood

Thank you to Ghasr Setareh (https://www.instagram.com/ghasr_setareh/) for arranging our trip to Iran.

🎥5-Star Hotel Tour in Iran: https://youtu.be/Rmo2Mtd-JSo
😃Follow Mr. Taster: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheMrtaster/
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

MASULEH, IRAN - During our trip to Iran, we had the privilege to visit Masuleh, an ancient village, high in the mountains of Gilan province of Iran. Masuleh is known for its unique architecture, a village that’s build on the side of the mountain where each house is built upon the neighbors roof. The entire village is a city in and of itself, which a market bazaar, restaurants, shops, and homes. It’s an amazing place to visit when you’re in Iran. #Masuleh #Iran #IranianFood

In this video I’ll first give you a tour of our guest house, where we stayed for the night. It was more like a small apartment, with a bedrooms, living room and kitchen. Next, we walked around the village for a few minutes before going to breakfast.

For breakfast, we went to the oldest Iranian teahouse in Masuleh, a place where people gather to eat, drink tea, and socialize throughout the morning and night. Iranian breakfast included bread, Iranian omelet of eggs and tomato paste and tea.

We had an amazing time visit Masuleh village in Iran, and thank you to everyone who made our visit to Iran possible.

Thank you to Ghasr Setareh (https://www.instagram.com/ghasr_setareh/) for arranging our trip to Iran.

w4saJ-V_dso.title: Shocking First Impressions of IRAN 🇮🇷 - Iranian Food + Attractions in Tehran!!
w4saJ-V_dso.description:
🎥5-Star Hotel Tour in Iran: https://youtu.be/Rmo2Mtd-JSo
😃Follow Mr. Taster: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheMrtaster/
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

TEHRAN, IRAN - In this video I’m going to share with you my first and initial impressions and experiences of visiting Tehran, Iran for the very first time. And then 14 days later, I share with you my final thoughts, the last day in Iran before leaving back home to Bangkok. Here it is, the first impressions, sights and attractions, Iranian food, unforgettable gifts, and most of all, the amazing people of Iran 🙏🙏.

Milad Tower - Rising to the sky, the Milad Tower is a huge communications tower in Tehran that makes up part of the iconic skyline. We didn’t go to the top, but it was nice to see it from the bottom.

Azadi Tower - In Tehran, the same day we arrived, we then visited the Azadi Tower, one of the landmarks and most important attractions in Tehran. It’s an amazing sight to see.

Koohpaye Restaurant - Darband, Tehran - Next we headed to an area of Tehran known as Darband, where we ate some Iranian street food snacks, followed by a huge celebratory dinner at Koohpaye Restaurant. Food was delicious, and so was the party for Mr. Taster!

14 Days of Travel in Iran: We then proceeded to travel in Iran for 14 days to many parts of the country. Most of these food tour videos of each location will be on my main channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/migrationology

1. RASHT
2. MASULEH
3. TABRIZ
4. SHIRAZ
5. ISFAHAN
6. CHABAHAR

We returned to Tehran, and here’s where this video re-picks up:

Bella Monica - Italian Restaurant - Thank you for hosting us where we received some of the most precious gifts I’ve ever received including a family portrait made from a Persian rug, and a prized Persian carpet from Tabriz.

Darvazeh Tehroon - Bam Land, Tehran - And to end this incredible trip to Iran, we had a final meal and good-bye at Darvazeh Tehroon before heading to the airport.

Thank you again to everyone who made our trip to Iran so memorable 🙏🙏.

Thank you to Ghasr Setareh (https://www.instagram.com/ghasr_setareh/) for arranging our trip to Iran.

Rmo2Mtd-JSo.title: Staying at a 5-Star Hotel in IRAN! Buffet Breakfast + Full Room Tour in Tehran, Iran!
Rmo2Mtd-JSo.description:
😃Follow Mr. Taster: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheMrtaster/
🎥Iran Airlines Food: https://youtu.be/bTPvMdhDr2c
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

Espinas Palace Hotel - During my trip to Tehran, Iran, we had the chance to stay at the amazing Espinas Palace Hotel, located on the outskirts of Tehran, overlooking the city. It’s a 5 Star hotel, and one of the best hotels in Tehran! #Tehran #Iran #IranianFood

Directly from the airport, we drove straight to the hotel, where the hospitality already shined. Staff were incredibly helpful and things all went smoothly. The room was spectacular, with a view of the snowy mountains of Tehran, and a unique orange colored mirror glass wall leading to the bathroom.

Iranian Breakfast - But the real part of Espinas Palace Hotel that blew me away was the breakfast buffet, including both Iranian and Western food. The main thing I loved the most was the omelet - both the Iranian omelet and the Western omelet. Both were unique and both were cooked to perfection. Don’t miss the omelet when you’re staying here.

Thank you to Espinas Palace Hotel for hosting my family and I in Tehran, Iran 🙏. I didn’t pay for my stay, but I chose to make this video.

XKt-jLqH_gU.title: Russian Street Food Market!! | Saint Petersburg, Russia! 🇷🇺
XKt-jLqH_gU.description:
🎥Russian Train Food: https://youtu.be/9K08tmeJRgs
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

During my visit to Saint Petersburg, Russia, I wanted to visit a local market. So we walked over to a market that wasn’t far from the hotel where we were staying. I wasn’t sure what to expect, but are always one of my favorite places to explore. #Russia #RussianFood #SaintPetersburg

Mix of cultures, flavors, ingredients, and foods - Something I was happily surprised about was the mix of cultures represented at the market in Saint Petersburg - there were a mix of people mainly from former Soviet countries like Tajikistan, Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan and the food represented that. After walking around the market for a little while, we then stopped to eat some Russian pickles from a friendly lady. Her pickles were delicious. Next I tried a bowl of meat and potato soup with dill. In the end I figured out they were from Tajikistan.

Kazan Cathedral - Russian Orthodox Church - Next up on this travel guide tour, we visited Kazan Cathedral, one of the iconic landmarks of Saint Petersburg. We proceeded to walking around the Church of the Savior on Blood - Russian Orthodox Church, and finally St. Isaac's Cathedral. Saint Petersburg, Russia is truly an amazing city and wonderful to walk around.

Russian Vodkaroom No. 1 - Russian Restaurant - Finally to end this food and attractions tour of Saint Petersburg, Russia, we had dinner at Russian Vodkaroom No. 1, an excellent Russian food restaurant known for its food and vodka. 5,822 RUB ($91.28) - Total price for everything

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

9WjrudLe4Dg.title: Russian Fishing Restaurant - Amazing Catch and Cook!! | Saint Petersburg, Russia!
9WjrudLe4Dg.description:
🎥Russian Train Food: https://youtu.be/9K08tmeJRgs
😊Sergey Baklykov: https://www.youtube.com/user/realrussiablog
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

Russkaya Rybalka (Russian Fishing Restaurant) - This is a legendary restaurant in Saint Petersburg, Russia, and I was excited to try it out. So Sergey (https://www.youtube.com/user/realrussiablog) and I drove over for an ultimate Russian fishing catch and cook meal!

It’s a full Russian seafood restaurant, but you can choose to catch your own seafood and have it cooked fresh. We ordered a trout, and then fished it, and they immediately smoked it. In 30 minutes our freshly smoked trout was ready. It was absolutely delicious, one of the best meals I ate in Russia. The fish was of course very fresh, and the smokiness was delicious.

I would highly recommend Russkaya Rybalka (Russian Fishing Restaurant) as a special restaurant to visit for Russian seafood when you’re in Saint Petersburg, Russia!

9K08tmeJRgs.title: Russia Train FOOD REVIEW - Moscow to Saint Petersburg | High-Speed Sapsan Express!
9K08tmeJRgs.description:
🎥Tour of Copenhagen, Denmark: https://youtu.be/_G6T6D8460U
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
🍌Mark Wiens Banana Chips - Worldwide Shipping Available Now: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens

Big thank you to Dmitry from Value of the Moment (https://valueofthemoment.com/) for helping us get on the right train! #Moscow #Russia #RussianTrain

One of the best ways to get from Moscow to Saint Petersburg, Russia, is on the high-speed Sapsan Express train. It’s extremely modern, very fast, and very convenient. I ended up purchasing business class seats, which weren’t that much more expensive than normal class. 

The Train - The Sapsan Express leaves Moscow from the Moscow Leningradsky Railway Station. Our seats were very comfortable, and very clean. Everything went smoothly and the train left immediately on time. Price - 3,435 RUB ($53.50) per ticket

The Food - Our seats on the Russian train included food, and you could choose a few different options. I chose the most Russian food sounding option, which included a few different dishes - a salad, and a main course. Overall, pretty good. Service was also excellent.

The train from Moscow to Saint Petersburg, Russia took I believe about 3.5 hours, and we arrived to Saint Petersburg!

Great experience, and I would highly recommend it.

https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

eEN4PqP7lno.title: World’s Best Vegetarian Food - $2.78 All You Can Eat!! | Banana Leaf Sadhya - Kerala, India!
eEN4PqP7lno.description:
🎥Whole Lamb in Lebanon: https://youtu.be/p8EvL2WDwJo
📺Ebbin’s Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC-wTAWLHOWLYyZI9m_JV8zg
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

Sadhya - Is a traditional Indian vegetarian banquet feast originating in Kerala, India. It’s not just a meal, but it’s an entire event, an experience of vegetarian food, natural ingredients and combinations of Ayurvedic medicinal values. There’s so much tradition involved, from the way you mix and match your different dishes, to the way you order your different dishes, and mix the sweets and salty dishes.

I can say without a doubt, this was the best vegetarian food I’ve ever had in my life. It was a meal experience.

Mothers Veg Plaza - Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India. Price - 200 INR ($2.78) per person, all you can eat. But usually by the first round of all the dishes, everyone is pretty full. I had a few more helpings of rice and curry to end this spectacular Indian food vegetarian feast.

Thank you to Ebbin from @Food N Travel by Ebbin Jose for taking us on this ultimate Indian food tour of Kerala, India!

There’s so much tradition involved, from the way you mix and match your different dishes, to the way you order your different dishes, and mix the sweets and salty dishes.

I can say without a doubt, this was the best vegetarian food I’ve ever had in my life. It was a meal experience.

Mothers Veg Plaza - Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India. Price - 200 INR ($2.78) per person, all you can eat. But usually by the first round of all the dishes, everyone is pretty full. I had a few more helpings of rice and curry to end this spectacular Indian food vegetarian feast.

Thank you to Ebbin from @Food N Travel by Ebbin Jose for taking us on this ultimate Indian food tour of Kerala, India!

hTumRZvgArA.description:
🎥Copenhagen Street Food Tour: https://youtu.be/gMNvp-83fDc
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

In this Copenhagen vlog, we did some sightseeing, walked around, ate some food, visiting CopenHill, and ended the day with some Mexican street tacos. #CopenHill #Copenhagen #Denmark

The Round Tower - 25 DKK ($3.70) - This is a landmark and historical monument of Copenhagen. It’s a great place to visit for a view of the city.

Hooked Nørrebro - For lunch we went to a place called Hooked, a laid back seafood restaurant serving mainly fast style fried seafood dishes like fish and chips and salmon burgers. Everything was fresh, a little greasy, but good. Total price - 375 DKK ($55.54)

CopenHill - Copenhagen - One of the highlights of this day in Copenhagen was visiting CopenHill, a newly opened and state of the art waste management system that doubles as a plastic ski slope. Amazing to see in person.

Christianshavn, Copenhagen - Next we took a walk over to Christianshavn one of the most artful neighborhoods of Copenhagen.

Hija de Sanchez - Finally, to end this day in Copenhagen, we went to Hija de Sanchez, where you’ll find properly delicious Mexican street food tacos. The tacos were excellent, and what stood out to me was the fresh tortillas. Total price - 100 DKK ($$14.81)

HCq-esCGDRE.title: Living in Copenhagen - $189 Apartment Tour in Vesterbro! | Denmark
HCq-esCGDRE.description:
🎥Copenhagen Street Food Tour: https://youtu.be/gMNvp-83fDc
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
Thank you to Visit Copenhagen: https://www.instagram.com/visitcopenhagen/

During our 2 week trip to Copenhagen, Denmark, we rented an apartment in a local area of the city. It was a fantastic area, a quiet and friendly neighborhood, but just a short distance from downtown Copenhagen. In this video, I’m going to give you a full video of our apartment in Copenhagen.

Vesterbro - When I mentioned we were staying in Vesterbro to many locals in Copenhagen, many mentioned that they loved the area, and that it was one of their favorite neighborhoods in Copenhagen. And I figured out why pretty quickly - the area is quiet and peaceful, yet not far from downtown, it has a nice friendly feel to it, and there are many great restaurants, cafes, and shops in the area. I would highly recommend Vesterbro when you visit or live in Copenhagen, I loved the area.

Total price - The price to rent this apartment on a short term basis like we did, was $189 per night, which came with two bedrooms, and a full house. It’s still not cheap, but when you compare it to a hotel room in Copenhagen, it’s much more affordable and you get much more space.

Thank you for watching living in Denmark, apartment tour in Copenhagen!

_G6T6D8460U.title: Tour of Copenhagen - Big Danish Lunch + Canal Boat Tour in Denmark!
_G6T6D8460U.description:
🎥Copenhagen Street Food Tour: https://youtu.be/gMNvp-83fDc
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
Thank you to Visit Copenhagen: https://www.instagram.com/visitcopenhagen/

Bicycle Ride - In order to really blend in with Danish culture in Copenhagen, you need to go around the city by bicycle. So on day one of our visit to Copenhagen, we jumped into a bicycle cart, and rode over the park. #Copenhagen #Denmark

Frederiksberg Have - Copenhagen has lots of beautiful parks, and we strategically went to one called Frederiksberg Have because it wasn’t far from where we were staying, and there was a restaurant I really wanted to try in the area.

Hansens Gamle Familiehave (https://goo.gl/maps/hxY3GdoVEg18h1PZA) - I love legendary classic restaurants, and Hansens Gamle Familiehave is about as historical and classic as Danish restaurants in Copenhagen get. I went straight for the Hansens lunch platter, which included two platters - first the cold appetizers like herring, and next the hot dishes like pork. Total bill for this huge Danish lunch platter - 718 DKK ($106.43)

Hey Captain (https://www.heycaptain.dk/) - One of the attractions I was most interested in doing during my time in Copenhagen, was to take a boat Copenhagen Canal Tour. Thanks to Visit Copenhagen and Hey Captain, for taking me on this fantastic and luxurious canal boat tour of Copenhagen. The drinks made it even better. Amazing boat tour, highly recommended in Copenhagen.

Folkehuset Absalon (https://goo.gl/maps/Sjq2tUUrg9LsRa6k9) - Finally for dinner we went o Folkehuset Absalon, a former church that has been opened as a community center coffee shop, and a family style restaurant at dinner. The place is packed every night, people come looking for a social dining atmosphere, sharing tables, and delicious home cooked styles Danish food. Food was delicious. Price - 100 DKK ($14.82)

And that wraps up this tour of Copenhagen, including Danish food and attractions!

Jl0C7_7RuH8.description:

👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

During our time in Lhasa, Tibet, we stayed at one of the best traditional Tibetan style guest houses in Lhasa. #Lhasa #Tibet #hotel

Hang-Suk Trichang Labrang Hotel - Situated in the old city of Lhasa, very close to Barkhor Street, this is a fantastic traditional Tibetan hotel. I like how they've preserved the traditional building, the courtyard, and the rooms.

Our room was huge, and in this video I'll give you a full tour of our mega-room in a traditional Tibetan style hotel in Lhasa. 

Thank you to Travel China & Tibet (https://www.travelchinatibet.com/), they sponsored my trip to Tibet, and they did an amazing job to cater to the exact things I wanted to do. Highly recommended when you visit Tibet.

VgqfZGtq_Kk.title: Sichuan Airlines FOOD REVIEW - Flying from Chengdu to Lhasa, Tibet!
VgqfZGtq_Kk.description:
🎥Tour of Seoul Incheon Airport: https://youtu.be/1V0cU9J03bA
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
🍌Mark Wiens Banana Chips - Worldwide Shipping Available Now: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens

Sichuan Airlines - In order to travel to Tibet, we took a flight with Sichuan Airlines from Chengdu to Lhasa. #Sichuan #Chengdu #Lhasa #airplanefood

I had no idea what to expect of Sichuan Airlines, but actually it’s a pretty nice airline, nicely maintained airplane, and the service was great. Even though it was a short 2 hour flight, they served a full meal of rice, and the best touch about food on Sichuan Airlines is that you can ask for Sichuan chili oil sauce to add to the top of your food - best touch ever for an airline - who wouldn’t want extra Sichuan chili oil on an airplane!!

Lhasa, Tibet - Landing in Lhasa was spectacular, the scenery and high elevation mountains were gorgeous. The airport is about an hour drive from the center of Lhasa, and so drove into Lhasa, and then checked into Hang-Suk Trichang Labrang Hotel.

Jokhang Temple, Barkhor Street - After checking in to our hotel, we then walked around Jokhang Temple and Barkhor Street, the center of the city and one of the most important places in Lhasa.

It was a great day, great flight with Sichuan Airlines for the first time.

Thank you to Travel China & Tibet Tours: https://www.travelchinatibet.com/

Thank you for watching, and be sure to subscribe and click the bell icon to get notified of more travel videos!

1V0cU9J03bA.title: Tour of Seoul Incheon International Airport - LOUNGE, ROBOTS + Shake Shack!
1V0cU9J03bA.description:
🎥$65 Apartment Tour in Seoul: https://youtu.be/LAAwyrc7OiA
🎥 Gwangjang Market Street Food: https://youtu.be/GalLzn7Tyzo
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

Incheon International Airport is the main international airport that caters to Seoul, South Korea. It's easily among the world's best airports, in terms of organization, things to do, food, and access to internet. If you fly in or out of Seoul Incheon International Airport, or if you have a layover, it's a good airport to be in. #Seoul #SouthKorea #airport

In this Seoul Incheon International Airport tour, we were flying out of Seoul, and have a few extra hours to walk around the airport. But completely unplanned, I say Shake Shack at the entrance of the airport, and couldn't resist the opportunity to eat a double shack - it was delicious.

Robots - Something you'll notice at Seoul Incheon International Airport are the robots that help with information - they seemed to follow us around a little bit. It's pretty cool, and you can talk to them.

Lounge - There are plenty of non-lounge lounges, that are fantastic at the airport and great for spending time in, but with a Priority Pass (from a credit card I use), I had access to one of the lounges. Food is overall, pretty good, with Korean food, kimchi, rice, and bulgogi.

That completes this full tour of Seoul Incheon International Airport, including Shake Shack!

lKYXAUQuIG4.title: Tour of Seoul - Market Shopping, Taking the Subway + Eel BBQ in South Korea!
lKYXAUQuIG4.description:
🎥$65 Apartment Tour in Seoul: https://youtu.be/LAAwyrc7OiA
🎥 Gwangjang Market Street Food: https://youtu.be/GalLzn7Tyzo
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

Seoul is an amazingly modern and clean city, especially for being a huge city in South Korea. It’s one of the most pedestrian friendly cities I’ve ever visited, with wide sidewalks, huge roads, parks, markets, and public walking spaces. In this video I’m taking you on a walking tour of Seoul - we’ll visit the Cheonggyecheon Stream, Gwangjang Market for some shopping, take the public local metro transportation, and finally since we needed to eat - we’ll try fresh Korean food eel bbq! #Seoul #travel #KoreanFood

Cheonggyecheon Stream - Seoul has done an amazing job at creating pedestrian walkways and parks. The Cheonggyecheon Stream is like a pedestrian park highway, right through the center of the city, and you never need to wait to cross roads.

Gwangjang Market - While most of the time people known Gwangjang Market for its street food market (myself included), it’s actually a huge market with everything available, from clothes to cooking supplies to cosmetics. I’m happy with my grill purchase.

Poong Chun Jang Eo Restaurant - Finally for lunch we took the subway over to Poong Chun Jang Eo Restaurant, a restaurant that serves fresh Korean eel. They grill it right in front of you, and serve it with all the banchan side dishes. Spectacular!
Total price - 64,000 KRW ($53.54)

🎵MUSIC: 
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

Seoul, South Korea - It’s a huge city, but it’s such a convenient and nice city to live in. The city functions well, the transportation systems are highly efficient, and there’s food and coffee shops everywhere you look. In this video I’m going to give you a full apartment tour in Seoul, and show you just a glimpse of what it’s like to live in Seoul, South Korea. #Seoul #SouthKorea #apartment

Apartment Tour - We rented an apartment for our stay on this trip to South Korea, for $65 per night. It was a studio apartment, but in a great location in Seoul (near Dongdaemun), and the apartment included everything we needed, including Love You slippers - which were a bonus. A lot of the accommodation in Seoul is apartments and sky rises since it’s such a cosmopolitan huge city.

I booked this apartment on Airbnb. If you use this link you can get $40 off your booking at no extra cost: https://www.airbnb.com/c/markw149

Hololok Coffee - Just across the street from our apartment was a coffee shop called Hololok Coffee. For me the coffee was on the weak side, but it was a nice place to sit and hang out.

p8EvL2WDwJo.title: Wine and Dine in Lebanon - Epic Sunday in Jezzine!
p8EvL2WDwJo.description:
🎥Travel Guide to Beirut: https://youtu.be/jc43UBgFGUY
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
🍌Mark Wiens Banana Chips - Worldwide Shipping Available Now: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens

JEZZINE, LEBANON #Lebanon #Jezzine #wine #travel

We had an amazing day exploring Jezzine, a gorgeous village in the mountains of Lebanon. They are home to the largest pine forest in the Middle East. The Karam family hosted us for amazing food and wine at their Karam Winery.

La Maison de la Forêt (https://goo.gl/maps/fbfawV7NJhJf3mQWA) - Before arriving at the winery, we stopped to try some Jezzine kibbeh.

Karam Winery (https://goo.gl/maps/PEg9NsLbpRVhS2KMA) - Thanks to the entire Karam family of Jezzine for hosting us at their amazing winery in Lebanon. The food and wine was delicious, and my favorite dish was the Musakhan - a Palestinian dish of bread soaked in olive oil with chicken and huge amounts of sumac.

🎵MUSIC: 
“Life is For Living”

LkOQPqgQ3C4.title: Lebanese Seafood - Eating LIONFISH in The Mediterranean Sea! | Batroun, Lebanon
LkOQPqgQ3C4.description:
🎥Travel Guide to Beirut: https://youtu.be/jc43UBgFGUY
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
🍌Mark Wiens Banana Chips - Worldwide Shipping Available Now: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens

Thank you to USAID - My visit to Lebanon was supported by the USAID Lebanon Enterprise Development Project.

Friends in the video:
Sept Winery: https://www.instagram.com/septwinery/
Colonel Craft Beer: https://www.instagram.com/colonelbeer/
Thank you to Maya
Fadi Abu Jaber: https://www.instagram.com/jordanality/
Kamel: https://www.instagram.com/feryal.boutique/

BATROUN, LEBANON - Batroun is a coastal city in Lebanon with ancient history and a vibrant culture - it’s known throughout Lebanon for its nightlife and energy. Today was a mixed day, we started by driving into the mountains to visit an amazing winery. From there, we headed back into the city to eat some local seafood sandwiches, and finally finished with Lebanese seafood at Colonel Brewery and Seafood Restaurant.

Sept Winery (https://goo.gl/maps/oonfdB6ns5GMUaJ3A) - An amazing local small batch wine produced in Batroun, Lebanon. The wine was fantastic as was the ambiance and food.

Georges Maalouf Kitchen (https://goo.gl/maps/jpAPmqfxAceDpqXf6) - Next we drove back to Batroun city and stopped for some Lebanese seafood sandwiches. The octopus and sardines were delicious.

Colonel Brewery and Seafood Restaurant (https://goo.gl/maps/7RHik1NSRNFBAF3x8) - An institution in Batroun, Colonel Brewery produces craft beer and also a variety of distilled spirits. They also have a seafood restaurant on the sea, and we actually had a table in the Mediterranean Sea (literally)! One of the unique fish we ate was lionfish, which is not native to the Meditteranean, but is an invasive species.

Accommodation in Batroun: Also, during our time in Batroun, we stayed at Villa Paradiso Batroun (https://goo.gl/maps/R451BhQJPVMj9b5f9), highly recommended. Fantastic boutique accommodation, staff, and breakfast.

🎵MUSIC: 
“Invested”
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

5ckGtpWtGeg.title: Lebanese Food Buffet - EATING EVERYTHING at Tawlet Ammiq Restaurant in Lebanon!
5ckGtpWtGeg.description:
🎥Travel Guide to Beirut: https://youtu.be/jc43UBgFGUY
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
🍌Mark Wiens Banana Chips - Worldwide Shipping Available Now: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens

Thank you to USAID - My visit to Lebanon was supported by the USAID Lebanon Enterprise Development Project.

Friends in the video:
Thank you to Maya
Kamel: https://www.instagram.com/feryal.boutique/

Tawlet Ammiq (https://goo.gl/maps/ZWzVy4i8LuduWgqe6) - For lunch in Beqaa Valley, Lebanon, we went to Tawlet Ammiq, an amazing eco-restaurant that empowers the local community and serves a huge buffet of local Lebanese food. The atmosphere is spectacular and it was a great opportunity to see the food being prepared by the amazing women and then to taste each and every dish.

Lebanese Food Buffet - First on the buffet, they had the entire meze salad sections, with all the familiar Lebanese classics like hummus and labneh. But the hot food section included some regional specific dishes, as well as home-style Lebanese food that’s not always easy to find at restaurants. A few of my favorite dishes were the marinated and grilled trout, and the Aleppo style kebabs in cherry sauce.

Along with delicious food and the variety of Lebanese food, one of the highlights of eating at Tawlet Ammiq is amazing atmosphere under the trees and the view over the Beqaa Valley.

An amazing restaurant and place to visit when you’re in Lebanon.

🎵MUSIC: 
“Better Together”
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

RjtpVeIH-3U.title: Staying at Ancient Cave Monastery in Kadisha Valley, Lebanon!
RjtpVeIH-3U.description:
🎥Travel Guide to Beirut: https://youtu.be/jc43UBgFGUY
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
🍌Mark Wiens Banana Chips - Worldwide Shipping Available Now: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens

Kadisha Valley, Lebanon - During my trip to Lebanon, one of the most beautiful places we visited was Kadisha Valley. Not only is it beautiful, but the valley is gorgeously beautiful and has been the site of Maronite monasteries and caves for centuries. #Lebanon #KadishaValley #travel

Saint Anthony's Monastery of Qozhaya - This is one of the oldest established monasteries in Kadisha Valley, Lebanon, and they have a guest house at the monastery. So for one night during our trip to Lebanon, we spent the night at the monastery. The room was basic, but fine for us, but breakfast wasn’t the best I’ve had in Lebanon.

Cave Chapels and Monasteries - What I enjoyed the most was walking around the cave chapels in the morning. These are the same caves where Maronite Christians hid and have lived for so long.

Great experience in Lebanon.

🎵MUSIC: 
“Choir Hymn”
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

jc43UBgFGUY.title: 5 Star Hotel in Beirut, Lebanon - BREAKFAST + ROOM TOUR at Hotel Albergo!
jc43UBgFGUY.description:
🎥Travel Guide to Beirut: https://youtu.be/jc43UBgFGUY
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
🍌Mark Wiens Banana Chips - Worldwide Shipping Available Now: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens

Thank you to Hotel Albergo for inviting us to stay: https://www.albergobeirut.com/ I did not pay for my stay at Hotel Albergo, but I chose to make a video and all thoughts and opinions are my own.

During our visit to Beirut, we had a chance to stay at Hotel Albergo, a 5 star Relais & Châteaux hotel property, with a stunning rooftop pool, and set in a historical building in the heart of Beirut. The rooms are each different, all with a Middle Eastern Oriental theme.

Breakfast - Before starting the room tour, we had breakfast and you can choose to either sit outside on the rooftop in the garden terrace, or inside the lounge. We chose the lounge for the ambiance and the classic antiques. Lebanese breakfast was delicious, traditional dishes, great quality.

Rooftop swimming pool - The highlight of Hotel Albergo was taking a swim in the rooftop swimming pool that also has a nice bar and a wonderful panoramic view of Beirut!

It was a short 1 night stay, but we had a great time. Again, thank you to Hotel Albergo in Beirut for hosting us.

During our visit to Beirut, we had a chance to stay at Hotel Albergo, a 5 star Relais & Châteaux hotel property, with a stunning rooftop pool, and set in a historical building in the heart of Beirut. The rooms are each different, all with a Middle Eastern Oriental theme.

Breakfast - Before starting the room tour, we had breakfast and you can choose to either sit outside on the rooftop in the garden terrace, or inside the lounge. We chose the lounge for the ambiance and the classic antiques. Lebanese breakfast was delicious, traditional dishes, great quality.

Rooftop swimming pool - The highlight of Hotel Albergo was taking a swim in the rooftop swimming pool that also has a nice bar and a wonderful panoramic view of Beirut!

It was a short 1 night stay, but we had a great time. Again, thank you to Hotel Albergo in Beirut for hosting us.

WBfGyaJZ7PY.title: Tour of BEIRUT, LEBANON - Attractions, Food, Coffee, and Best Mediterranean Views!
WBfGyaJZ7PY.description:
🎥Ultimate Street Food Tour in Beirut: https://youtu.be/wSwpV85OXNs
👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
🍌Mark Wiens Banana Chips - Worldwide Shipping Available Now: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens

Beirut, Lebanon is an amazing city. It’s a city that’s been through a lot, but the people hold it together. In this simple and fun travel guide to Beirut, we’ll eat some delicious food and visit some of the famous sights of Beirut. #Beirut #Lebanon

Kamel - Feryal Boutique: https://www.instagram.com/feryal.boutique/

Feryal - Mouneh Boutique (https://goo.gl/maps/z3C9yuj8vRcKYTBU7) - Kamel and his family source the best food products and ingredients from across Lebanon. I bought some sour young grape juice and pomegranate molasses to bring home to Thailand with me. Go say hi to Kamel when you’re in Beirut!

Basterma Mano (https://goo.gl/maps/C5rrEn2jLyqnVsLS6) - The highlight here is the soujouk on the shawarma, and it’s delicious. The basterma is good too, but the soujouk was the winner for me. Soujouk Sandwich - 5,000 LBP ($3.32)

Mossis Restaurant (https://goo.gl/maps/uvH9ddd4NFXt27VC9) - Since we were in the area, Kamel knew another sandwich shop he’d been going to for years. We had roast beef, soujouk, and the kind owners gave us a plate of basterma on the side - delicious. Sandwich - 6,000 LBP ($3.98)

Al Falamanki Raouche - This is a cafe and restaurant serving all sorts of Lebanese food, and one of the highlights of coming here is to enjoy the amazing views of the iconic Raouche Rocks - Pigeons’ Rock. It’s not cheap, but a very nice place to hang out in Beirut.

Next on this tour of Beirut, we stopped at the beautiful Mohammad Al-Amin Mosque and Saint George Greek Orthodox Cathedral in the heart of Beirut. And lastly, we walked along the gorgeous Corniche Beirut waterfront.

Hotel Albergo (https://goo.gl/maps/5ndJzdavkRBnV5oQ9) - We were invited for a rooftop sunset drink at the top of Hotel Albergo, a beautiful historical hotel in Beirut. The view was outstanding, and a perfect was to finish a day in Beirut.

Hope you enjoyed this simple Beirut travel guide!

🎵MUSIC: 
“Unchained”
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

tuJu2VPIR-Q.title: Guide to Cusco, Peru - Amazing HOTEL TOUR + Plaza De Armas and Peruvian Dinner!
tuJu2VPIR-Q.description:

👕T-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

Casona la Recoleta: https://www.booking.com/hotel/pe/casona-la-recoleta.en.html?aid=808668 (affiliate link) Highlighly recommended place to stay in Cusco. 

Price - I paid $147 USD per night for 3 adults, 1 child.

CUSCO, PERU - I loved visiting Cusco, Peru. It’s a city of amazing history and culture, and high elevation. The air is so fresh, the markets are vibrant, there’s delicious food, and it’s just beautiful. This is a quick hotel tour where we stayed and a walking tour of the main plaza of Cusco. #Cusco #Peru #travelguide

Plaza De Armas - This is the center square and landmark of Cusco, an amazing area to walk around and just to enjoy life. The two major churches are the Church of the Society of Jesus and the Cathedral of Cusco. 

El Samaritano Restaurant - For dinner, we went over to a small local Peruvian food restaurant just around the corner from our hotel. I ordered the lomo saltado, stir fried beef with potatoes. Lomo saltado - Price - 3.5 PEN ($1.05)

ou-QJmkwIz8.title: Tour of Miraflores - PERUVIAN FOOD LUNCH, Ocean Views + Great Coffee! | Lima, Peru
ou-QJmkwIz8.description:
🎥Living in Brazil - Apartment Tour: https://youtu.be/iX4wJQU0xDY
🍌Get BANANA CHIPS: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens
👕Get t-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/

Miraflores, Lima, Peru - One of the best neighborhood to live in or stay in when you visit Lima is Miraflores. It’s a great area to walk around, there are parks, oceanside, and plenty of cafes, restaurants and shopping. We landed in Lima, got checked into our apartment (https://www.airbnb.com/c/markw149), and immediately took a walk to go eat lunch. Here’s a little walking tour of Miraflores, Lima. #Lima #Peru #travel

Also check out my Lima Travel Guide for exact tips and locations: https://migrationology.com/travel-guides/lima-peru/

Océano Azul - I just searched this restaurant on Google and it looks pretty good and it was in walking distance from our apartment. Ceviche was pretty good, and a nice atmosphere and staff. Total price - 196 PEN ($59.33)

Parque Kennedy - This is a main landmark and park in Miraflores. It’s great to walk around, stroll, and people hang out at the park until l ate at night. You can also stop at Parroquia La Virgen Milagrosa church when you’re there.

Larcomar - This is the major open air shopping center in Lima, overlooking the coast. It’s nicely done, and I like the cafes overlooking the water.

Puku Puku Café Larco - I started with an Americano - 7.50 PEN ($2.27), and it was wonderful. I like how they use local Peruvian coffee. Then Sebastian offered to make us a Mochaccino. That was very nice of him, and it was delicious, my first time to have a mochaccino. Thank you Sebastian!

Wong Supermarket - Finally, right in the heart of Miraflores, across the street from Kennedy Park is Wong Supermarket - a gourmet, kind of expensive, but very nice supermarket.

Lima is an amazing city to travel to or to live in, and Miraflores is a great area of the city to base yourself in.

🎵MUSIC: 
“Liability”
https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

jA1q1tuFvAE.title: Hotel Tour in Rio De Janeiro, Brazil + Best Chicken Hearts & Garlic Bread!
jA1q1tuFvAE.description:
🎥Living in Brazil - Apartment Tour: https://youtu.be/iX4wJQU0xDY
👕Get t-shirts and caps: https://migrationology.com/store/
🍌Banana Chips are available now: https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens

Thank you to Novotel Botafogo for sponsoring my stay: https://www.accorhotels.com/gb/hotel-9631-novotel-rj-praia-de-botafogo/index.shtml I thought it was a great business or travel hotel (affordable, about $75 - $150 per night), and especially it’s located in a great location in Rio de Janeiro.

Grave Cafe - A bit of an interesting cafe in Rio de Janeiro, more of an art space and underground music venue. Not fully my style, but coffee was very good.
Double espresso - 9 BRL ($2.40)

Galeto Sat's - This was the highlight for me. I didn’t know if I was going to have time to eat here during my trip to Rio de Janeiro, but on my final day, we did, and I’m glad. The chicken hearts and garlic bread were the best I’ve ever had anywhere. And the spring chicken with the sauce was outstanding.
Total price - 108 BRL ($28.79)

Restaurante Cervantes - Sandwiches were ok, the beef was the best, so juicy.
Total price - 78 BRL ($20.80)

And that completes this small travel tour and hotel review tour in Rio De Janeiro, Brazil. Thank you for watching, and many more travel guides, tips, and reviews coming!

“Esta Noche”

iX4wJQU0xDY.title: Living in Brazil - LOCAL APARTMENT TOUR in Belém | Accommodation For $67.60 Per Night!
iX4wJQU0xDY.description:
🎥Tour of Manaus - Amazon’s Largest City: https://youtu.be/hx2CoxIdP64
🎥Açaí - Superfood of The Amazon: https://youtu.be/iGU6dXuIcJE
📷Camera Gear I use: https://kit.com/markwiens/camera-video-gear

Get $40 OFF Booking Accommodation on Airbnb: 
https://www.airbnb.com/c/markw149


Belém, State of Pará, Brazil - During our trip to Brazil, one of my favorite cities that we visited was Belém, an amazing city in the State of Pará, in the Amazon Rainforest of Brazil. The food and lifestyle in Belém is fantastic.

We traveled along with Guilherme and Rafa from Rio4Fun (), so we were 5 adults total, and so it made sense to rent an apartment for our 5 day stay. It was well worth it, in a good location, very spacious, and with a full kitchen so we could cook and make coffee.

For this 3 bedroom house in Brazil, we paid $67.60 per night (5 adults). This is a great deal, especially considering that Brazil is really not a cheap country to travel in.

Açaí Puro Pará - After the full house tour of living in Brazil, we walked over to Açaí Puro Pará to eat some açaí, a daily staple in Pará. Açaí - 18 BRL ($2.09) per liter (but they said during açaí season, prices are much lower).

hx2CoxIdP64.title: Tour of Manaus, Brazil - Biggest City in AMAZON RAINFOREST | Wild Fruit, Attractions, and Dinner!
hx2CoxIdP64.description:
🎥Flying from Bangkok to Rio de Janeiro: https://youtu.be/SA-SromGdGg
🎥Eating Ants in Manaus: https://youtu.be/6HngwHe3QCA
🍌Banana Chips available now!! https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens
👕T-shirts: https://migrationology.com/store/

Thanks to Guilherme (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqKjl-xepqcSTkJGR9pq_vQ) for taking us around Brazil.

MANAUS, BRAZIL - From Belo Horizonte, we flew to Manaus, a city in the State of Amazonas, which is in the heart of the Amazon Rainforest. It’s the biggest city in the Amazon, and it’s surrounded by massive rivers and jungles. I was so excited to be there. We landed in the mid-afternoon, so we just had a few hours to walk around and explore, and get our first impressions of the Amazon. #Manaus #BrazilianFood #Amazon

Mercure Manaus Hotel - Thank you to Mercure Manaus Hotel for hosting all of us during our stay in Manaus, and for the amazing dinner.

We first drove to the market where we sampled a few local fruits. Most of the fruit stalls were closed, but a few were open and mainly we tried Cupuaçu and a type of wild passion fruit.

Amazon Theatre - One of the most important landmarks and sights of Manaus is the Amazon Theater, a beautiful theater in the middle of the city.

Restaurante Canto da Peixada - I wanted to try a local freshwater fish dinner before going back to the hotel, so we stopped to eat a grilled tambaqui, one of the prized fish of Manaus, Brazil. It was delicious. Total price - 89.70 BRL ($22.96)

Dinner at Amazon Restaurant at Mercure Hotel Manaus - Finally we were invited for dinner back at the hotel where they prepared us an amazing Amazon meal including a huge mix of dishes. I didn’t even know I was digging into the piranha soup, and it was so good. Freshwater turtle is also a major part of the Amazonian food diet.

It was a great few hours and my first impressions of Manaus, Amazonas, Brazil.

Thanks to Guilherme and Rafa from Rio4Fun and Rio4Food. Check out their videos here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqKjl-xepqcSTkJGR9pq_vQ

J0QgsmmUbJM.title: BRAZIL NEIGHBORHOOD TOUR - Brazilian Coffee, Lunch, and Imperial Palm Trees in Belo Horizonte!
J0QgsmmUbJM.description:
🎥Flying from Bangkok to Rio de Janeiro: https://youtu.be/SA-SromGdGg
🍌Banana Chips available now!! https://m.me/BananaJoe?ref=MarkWiens
👕T-shirts: https://migrationology.com/store/

Thanks to Guilherme (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqKjl-xepqcSTkJGR9pq_vQ) for taking us around Brazil.

BELO HORIZONTE, BRAZIL - Belo Horizonte is a city in the Brazilian state of Minas Gerais. It’s a beautiful city, very modern and metropolitan, and it’s one of the most well known states in Brazil for food. In this video, we just had a day off and walked around, ate lunch, went to a coffee shop, and visited some attractions in the city like Praça da Liberdade. (NOTE: Watch my full Belo Horizonte food tour here: https://youtu.be/b1Ys_IYpMsg) #BeloHorizonte #coffee #travelvlogs

Prato feito - plate of the day - Here’s a term to know in Portuguese when you visit Brazil, which means the plate of the day. Plenty of simple restaurants will serve a plate of the day option that’s all you need on one plate. Today was the pork ribs, with collard greens, rice and cassava. Price - 13 BRL ($3.24) per plate

Rental car - about $65 per day - Throughout our Trip to Brazil, we rented cars in every city we visited, usually with Hertz (Localiza). Price came to about $65 per day.

OOP Café - We continued on to OOP Café, one of the best cafes in Belo Horizonte serving gourmet freshly roasted Brazilian coffee. Great place to have fantastic coffee when you’re in Belo Horizonte. Price - 7 BRL ($1.74) per cup

Praça da Liberdade - Finally in this visiting tour of attractions and daily living life in Brazil, we walked around Praça da Liberdade, a center square in the city, a park, and I especially loved the imperial palm trees. Big bottle water - 6 BRL ($1.49)

Thanks to Guilherme and Rafa from Rio4Fun and Rio4Food. Check out their videos here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqKjl-xepqcSTkJGR9pq_vQ

oahmKpbWTQo.title: Very Unique BRAZILIAN BANANA Meat Stew (Barreado) + Train Ride to Morretes, Brazil!
oahmKpbWTQo.description:
🎥Flying from Bangkok to Rio de Janeiro: https://youtu.be/SA-SromGdGg
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/
Subscribe here ► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
Guilherme ► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqKjl-xepqcSTkJGR9pq_vQ

CURITIBA, BRAZIL: Along with eating a massive 5 kg. Sandwich the day before in Curitiba, we decided to take a historic train ride to Morretes. Morretes is a beautiful little town and happens to be known for barreado, a unique Brazilian banana meat stew. #Morretes #Brazil #BrazilianFood

Serra Verde Express - Historically it was used as cargo transportation, things grown in Morretes, to Curitiba. Now the train is used for entertainment and people from across Brazil come to take the incredibly beautiful leisure train ride for the spectacular views of the forest and mountains. The train ride was a little slow, but fun, and the views were spectacular. It took about 3.5 hours and we arrived in Morretes, a steamy jungle town.
Train ride - 125 BRL ($30.96) per person

Hotel e Restaurante Nhundiaquara - After walking around Morretes for a few minutes, we headed straight to Hotel e Restaurante Nhundiaquara, one of the classic restaurants serving barreado. In order to assemble a plate of Barreado, you take some meat stew cooked in a clayport, add in cassava powder, and mash it around. Then you add banana - not plantain or cooking banana - but just straight real sweet bananas. It’s very unique and unlike any other dish I’ve eaten. Overall I enjoyed it, it was simple in taste, but with the balance of salty and sweet, and plenty of different textures.
Price - 39 BRL ($9.66) per person

Thanks to Guilherme and Rafa from Rio4Fun and Rio4Food. Check out their videos here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqKjl-xepqcSTkJGR9pq_vQ

7HstJqjGzFg.title: Layover in Frankfurt - GERMAN FOOD, Doner Kebab, and Sightseeing in Frankfurt, Germany!
7HstJqjGzFg.description:
🎥Lufthansa Airlines Food Review ► https://youtu.be/SA-SromGdGg
Subscribe here ► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

Frankfurt is home to Lufthansa Airlines, one of the biggest in Europe. Not only can you fly on Lufthansa to visit Germany, but there are many connecting flights and therefore many layovers in Frankfurt. 

So what should you do with a long layover in Frankfurt, Germany?

I had something like 15 hours, but even having  8 hours would be plenty of time to get to the center or Frankfurt for some sightseeing, German food and walking around.

First step is to get out of the airport and catch the train into the center of Frankfurt - that can be a little confusing as Frankfurt Airport is kind of confusing. Anyway, navigate your way to the train station at the airport. There you can buy a ticket - I bought a 5 people group ticket for 16.60 EUR. They had other pricing options as well.

Frankfurt (Main) Hauptwache - This is the center of Frankfurt and it took about 15 minutes from the airport.

Römerberg - Just a 10 minute walk from Hauptwache station is Römerberg, the historical center of Frankfurt and a wonderful public square to walk around and do some sightseeing. But we continued walking to find some German food - specifically Frankfurt food.

Gaststätte Atschel - This restaurant specializes in local Frankfurt German food. We ordered a number of dishes including apple wine and Frankfurter sausages with sauerkraut which are delicious and a food you can’t miss. Total price - 47.60 EUR

Köylü-Döner - Just down the road from Gaststätte Atschel is Köylü-Döner, one of the best places in Frankfurt for a Turkish doner kebab which is very popular in Germany and absolutely delicious. Price - 4.90 EUR

The Holy Cross Brewing Society - Finally, just a last minute decision, we had a coffer at The Holy Cross Brewing Society which was wonderful. After coffee we headed back to Frankfurt Airport to catch our flight.

If you have a layover in Frankfurt, Germany, go out and explore and eat some food!

🎵MUSIC: https://goo.gl/HwVjdo

FvIToa2AXJw.description:

Big thank you to Beach Luxury Hotel for hosting me and my family in Karachi, Pakistan. I did not pay for my stay, but I was not required to post a video, and all thoughts in this video are my own.

Beach Luxury Hotel, Karachi, Pakistan (Avani Hotels)

The hotel is one of the classic old hotels in Karachi, Pakistan. Some of the featured in the hotel are a little old and could do with a renovation, but at the same time that's part of what gives the hotels its charm and character. There's not really a beach, but more like a waterfront or lagoon front, but that does make for a nice ambiance.

First we were invited by the manager to eat dinner at Casbah Restaurant, the hotels main seafood dinner restaurant. Food was good and seafood was fresh. At the same time, Atif Aslam was having a concert at the hotel. So we were able to listen to the concert while eating for an amazing atmosphere.

We had a great stay, than you again to Beach Luxury Hotel, Karachi, Pakistan!

If you book accommodation with my link https://bit.ly/2OEzeMr I'll receive a small commission at no expense to you.

dTdExXVWZkE.title: Etihad Airways FOOD REVIEW | Bangkok to Abu Dhabi UAE Airport to Karachi!
dTdExXVWZkE.description:
Subscribe here► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

Second trip to Pakistan, and this time we took Etihad Airways from Bangkok to Abu Dhabi Airport to Karachi. I was excited to fly on Etihad because it was my first time.

Our first flight from Bangkok to Abu Dhabi, UAE, was fantastic, although it left late due to some unforeseen circumstances. The flight was great, staff were nice and food was ok.

When we landed at Abu Dhabi we only had about 45 minutes until our next flight to Karachi departed. And we had to board a bus that dropped us off on the opposite side of the airport and had to get through security checks. I was hoping to give you a bit more of an Abu Dhabi airport tour in this video, but we literally had to sprint through the airport to our next flight. 

We got to the gate just in time, they were already boarding.

Since Abu Dhabi to Karachi was just a 1 hour 45 min flight and it was in the middle of the night, there wasn't much food on the flight apart from a few sandwiches.

Great to be back in Pakistan and I can't wait to share a few videos with you!

Watch my Pakistan Food Videos: https://youtu.be/bg2II5DIJ0E

Thank you for watching this Etihad Airways food review videos!

vdRqhgz6LkQ.title: Thai Airways FOOD REVIEW - Flying From Sapporo, Hokkaido, Japan to Bangkok
vdRqhgz6LkQ.description:
Subscribe here► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

I flew Thai Airways from Sapporo, Hokkaido, Japan back home to Bangkok, Thailand. This video shows the entire process, starting from Sapporo Station back to Bangkok.

First of all, before catching the JR Rail train to the airport, I put my suitcase in a locker in Sapporo Station and had a quick lunch. They have a number of locker sizes, but many for 500 JPY ($4.48) for the day.

JR Rail to Airport - 1,590 JPY ($14.26) - You can buy JR train tickets for cheaper if you don't reserve a seat, but you also run the risk of having to stand for the entire journey. But it's up to you, they have JR trains running in either direction and it's convenient and easy to use.

New Chitose Airport - We arrived to New Chitose Airport, the airport that serves Sapporo, and headed straight to catch our flight on Thai Airways.

The food serves on Thai Airways for this flight was Japanese food style because the plane left from Japan. Overall, food was ok, not the best airplane food I've had, but the bad.

Thank you for watching this Thai Airways food review videos!

mlkM_8Fftb4.title: Bangkok 5 Star Luxury Hotels - MANDARIN ORIENTAL Full Suite Tour + 10 Fruits for Breakfast!
mlkM_8Fftb4.description:
Watch more of my hotel reviews: https://youtu.be/Y8aqakNL8No
Book Mandarin Oriental Hotel (affiliate link): https://bit.ly/2Uilh9f

I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Bangkok as part of The Best of Bangkok Food Tour with The Hungry Tourist (https://www.instagram.com/the.hungry.tourist/) and Puppup (https://www.instagram.com/puppup_foodlife/).

It has an honor to receive an upgrade to our room at Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Bangkok along the Chao Phraya River. The hotel is a classic in Bangkok, one of the oldest, and with a significant history of catering to travelers along the banks of the river. They upgraded us to a suite room in the newer wing of the hotel, and it was a stunning luxurious hotel room with a nice view of the river.

Breakfast is also pretty good, served along the Chao Phraya river. You have a choice of plenty of both Western, Thai, and even some Chinese foods for breakfast, plus a nice selection of Thai tropical fruits.

I had an amazing stay at Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Bangkok and hope you enjoyed this tour!

You can watch more of my hotel reviews and Mark Abroad travel videos here: https://youtu.be/Y8aqakNL8No

rIrhsBz8WUs.title: Uzbekistan Airways FOOD REVIEW - Flying from Bangkok to Tashkent, Uzbekistan
rIrhsBz8WUs.description:
Check out my highlights of Uzbekistan: https://goo.gl/6NSDmz
T-shirts and caps: https://goo.gl/6WdK1l

Bangkok → Tashkent

In this video we traveled from Bangkok to Tashkent on Uzbekistan Airways... I hadn't even really heard of Uzbekistan Airways before taking my first flight with them.

The airplane was a little bit on the older side, no personal tv's, which wasn't a problem for me since it wasn't that long of a flight, but with kind of aged bucket seats.

For dinner there was a choice of fish or chicken, I chose the chicken though I had a bite of the fish. The chicken came in patty form, in tomato sauce. They were alright, not the best airplane food I've ever had, but not bad.

We arrived safely in the middle of the night at Islam Karimov Tashkent International Airport, and were met by someone to escort us through customs - thank you Bekruz for arranging that - it was very convenient.

In Tashkent, we stayed at Wyndham Tashkent Hotel (aff link: https://goo.gl/zTX5FA)

Overall, flight on Uzbekistan Airways was alright, but nothing extraordinary.

Thank you for watching this airline travel review!

T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

Paradise Malahide Hotel (also spelled Paradis Malahide) is an amazing hotel on the shores of Lake Kivu, near Gisenyi Rwanda. The hotel occupies a small peninsula that's surrounded by the lake water, making it incredibly serene, peaceful and beautiful.

One my latest trip to Rwanda, my wife, son, and my Dad and I, all stayed at Paradis Malahide Hotel for a few nights to relax and enjoy Lake Kivu.

We had a bungalow style room, which cost about $90 US per night for a double, self contained.

The highlight for me was the actual grounds of the hotel, being about to get incredible views of Lake Kivu while relaxing on an outdoor sofa. The service at Paradis Malahide and the food - particularly breakfast - was also incredible.

If you visit Gisenyi, Rwanda, and have a few days to relax at Lake Kivu, I would highly recommend Paradise Malahide.

►If you use this link (https://www.booking.com/hotel/rw/paradis-malahide.html?aid=808668) to book, I will get a small commission at not expense to you.

fdRr8rpKjf0.title: Mombasa Luxury Hotels - Full Tour of ENGLISH POINT MARINA -  Beach Hotel in Mombasa, Kenya!
fdRr8rpKjf0.description:
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

Thanks to Hotel English Point (https://www.hotelenglishpoint.com/) for hosting me and my family in Mombasa, Kenya. I did not pay for me stay here. That being said, we had an incredible stay.

During my food trip to Mombasa, Kenya (you can watch the full video series here: ), we stayed at Hotel English Point, located across a channel of water from Mombasa Island. It's in a great location though, with easy access to the center of the city, yet far enough so it's quiet and peaceful, and yet you still have a nice view of Mombasa from the hotel.

The rooms, which are actually more like full entire apartment units, are very spacious, extremely modern, and very well designed. So well designed and clean in fact that it took me a while to find out where the fridge was located.

In this video I'm taking you on a full tour of one of the best hotels in Mombasa, taking a quick swim, eating breakfast, and then a full room tour.

Thank you for watching and thank you again to Hotel English Point Marina for hosting me in Mombasa, Kenya!

--

8D1nWbtaTFo.title: Living in Ghana - ACCRA HOUSE TOUR + Neighborhood | $70 Per Night in Ghana, West Africa!
8D1nWbtaTFo.description:
I booked this Vientiane apartment on Airbnb► https://goo.gl/yWJmFA (use my affiliate link for $33 off your first booking)
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad

I was very excited to visit Ghana in West Africa!

During out stay, it was me, my wife, and our baby son, we rented a house on Airbnb. It was a very nice place to stay, offered us plenty of room and it was in a very nice neighborhood near the coast in Accra.

There are many different options of accommodation when you visit or when you are living in Accra. So I hope this gives you a quick glimpse into a type of living in a wealthier neighborhood in Accra, Ghana. 

Something I really loved was being able to walk out the gate, and go shopping at small family run shops, and buy fruit and vegetables. The fruit in Ghana is excellent!

Thank you for watching, and again, you can use my link to Airbnb (https://goo.gl/yWJmFA ) to get a discount if you rent an apartment or house anywhere you travel.

0EP4m0Bk8AE.title: Kenya Airways FOOD REVIEW - Bangkok to Nairobi to Accra | Africa Travel Vlog!
0EP4m0Bk8AE.description:
►Credit card I use: https://www.referyourchasecard.com/19/IVL6K6FPQ1 (affiliate link)
►Subscribe here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
►T-shirts: https://migrationology.com/store/

Kenya Airways

We started this journey in Bangkok, Thailand, leaving early in the morning. Our first leg of the trip was from Bangkok to Nairobi. Flight went well, overall the food was decent.

We had just a short layover in Nairobi. During the layover, I stopped for a cup of coffee at Java House, one of the best local chains of Kenyan coffee in Kenya.

Second leg of the trip was with Kenya Airways from Nairobi to Accra, Ghana. Again, the flight went well, and they served us lunch on the flight. Staff were all very friendly, and the food was pretty good.

Welcome to Ghana!

SfDmBOzGdCU.title: PARADISE Thai Island Hotel - CAPTAIN HOOK RESORT on Koh Kood Island, Thailand!
SfDmBOzGdCU.description:
►Book Captain Hook Resort here: https://www.agoda.com/captain-hook-resort/hotel/koh-kood-th.html?CID=1452029 (affiliate link)

Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

Watch my full Koh Kood video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sfMTQhiVdzg

At the end of our trip to Eastern Thailand, and end of our time on Koh Kood Island, we decided to stay for a couple nights or relaxation at Captain Hook Resort. It's a well known resort, isolated on its own beach and peninsula - and actually I didn't even know this at first, but you have to take a small boat ride to get there - you can't even drive there. So it's very quiet, very relaxing, and the natural beauty is spectacular.

We had a great time and really enjoyed some peace and relaxation. The food at the resort is pretty decent as well.

Check out Captain Hook Resort► https://www.agoda.com/captain-hook-resort/hotel/koh-kood-th.html?CID=1452029 (This is not sponsored, I paid for our stay, but this is an affiliate link)

O6uKLPhq9I8.title: Chanthaburi, Thailand Travel Guide - ROCKET ICE CREAM, Riverside Hotel, Coffee, and Walking Tour!
O6uKLPhq9I8.description:
Chanthaburi is a charming city full of history, in the Eastern part of Thailand.

From Bangkok, we drove to Chanthaburi, and it was about a 3 hour drive. One of the charms of the city is the old riverfront community.

Tamajun Hotel - https://www.agoda.com/partners/partnersearch.aspx?pcs=1&cid=1452029&hl=en&hid=869492 (this is an affiliate link) - I chose to stay here because it's a classic guest house, affordable and located right on the river front. Rooms are a little small and dark, but you can't beat the location and classic feel. Overall, a good stay.

C.A.P - Also located in old town Chathaburi, C.A.P. is one of the best places to drink coffee. It's a hang out spot and the coffee in wonderful.

Rocket Ice Cream (ไอศกรีมตราจรวด จันทบุรี) -  This is a historic ice cream shop you can't leave Chanthaburi without trying. Micah enjoyed it!

Cathedral of Immaculate Conception - This is the main cathedral of old town Chanthaburi. It's especially nice to visit in the evening.

This is just a short walking tour of Chanthaburi. It's a nice place to visit in Thailand for a few days. And there are also many other things to do in the province.

Check out my full Eastern Thailand food and travel video series  here:

i9GoWDhGgNc.title: Luang Prabang Travel Guide - WHERE TO STAY, Street Food, and BEST COFFEE in Laos!
i9GoWDhGgNc.description:
►Phounsab Guesthouse: https://www.agoda.com/phounsab-guesthouse/hotel/luang-prabang-la.html?cid=1452029 (affiliate link)
►Subscribe: https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
►T-shirts: https://migrationology.com/store/

Luang Prabang is an amazing heritage and beautiful city in Laos. The streets are relaxing and charming, the view of the Mekong River are impressive, and the food and coffee is delicious.

Here's just a quick and simple Luang Prabang travel guide about the hotel I stayed at, a few things to do like visit the morning market, and having a great cup of coffee at Saffron overlooking the river.

Phounsab Guesthouse: https://www.agoda.com/phounsab-guesthouse/hotel/luang-prabang-la.html?cid=1452029 (this is an affiliate link, if you book from my link I'll earn a small commission, but I recommend things I personally did) - I paid $51 per night for our room. Overall, great clean hotel, and the location was perfect.

Later on in the trip we also stayed at Apple Guesthouse: https://www.agoda.com/apple-guesthouse/hotel/luang-prabang-la.html?cid=1452029 - another wonderful choice that has more of a family guesthouse feel to it.

Hope you have an amazing trip to Luang Prabang, enjoy walking around, the food, and the coffee!

--

rDQGA--JIM4.title: Lao Airlines REVIEW from Vientiane to Luang Prabang + Pre-Flight Noodles!
rDQGA--JIM4.description:
Check out my Vientiane Travel Guide► https://migrationology.com/travel-guides/vientiane-laos/
Subscribe here► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

March 2018

The previous time I traveled from Vientiane, Laos to the northern city of Luang Prabang I took a bus. But the bus is quite a long journey, and with a baby, on this trip we decided to fly with Lao Airlines.

Lao Airlines is the national airline of Laos. It was just a very short 30 minute flight from Vientiane to Luang Prabang, but it all went smoothly. We checked in at Vientiane and went through security in about 15 minutes. The flight was only about 30 minutes, and we landed in Luang Prabang.

You can watch all the Lao food videos here: https://bit.ly/2EKXm9P

Thank you for watching this Lao Airlines food and travel review.

9xWr1dZ2yco.description:

Subscribe here► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

March 2018

Bangkok Airways is known as Asia's boutique airline, and it really is quite a few steps above most of the budget, short flight airlines that operate in Southeast Asia.

I had flown them once before, but it had been a while ago. So on our recent trip to Vientiane, Laos, I checked the prices of the flights, and we got a good deal, so I went for it.

For starters, you'll notice great service, from the check in process, to the lounge, to the flight. But the pink sandwiches... haha, they were actually pretty good.

Our flight was very short, but it was a great flight and we arrived to Vientiane safe and sound.

Have you flown with Bangkok Airways before? Thank you for watching this Bangkok Airways review.

Check out my Vientiane Travel Guide► https://migrationology.com/travel-guides/vientiane-laos/

We just had a short stay at this accommodation in Merida, but it was very fun and a very nice place.

Ph3lAVRU1UE.title: Asiana Airlines FOOD REVIEW - Flying from Bangkok to Incheon to Honolulu - Korean Food!
Ph3lAVRU1UE.description:
Flying on Asiana Airlines from Bangkok to Honolulu!
►Watch the full Korean food tour layover here: https://youtu.be/oaJoZDJMQyU
►Subscribe here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
►T-shirts: https://migrationology.com/store/

December 2017

Normally when my wife and I fly from Bangkok to visit family in the US, we have taken Korean Air. But on this trip we found a better deal on Asiana Airlines, which is another major airline based in South Korea.

As soon as we entered the airplane, the service was great, and we had baby friendly seats, so we were all the way at the front of the airplane with plenty of leg space.

For the first flight from Bangkok to Incheon they served us dinner at midnight and I had the Korean bibimbap which was excellent.

We then had a 14 hour layover, where we went out and ate our way through Incheon.

►Watch the full Korean Food Tour Layover here: https://youtu.be/oaJoZDJMQyU

For our next flight from Incheon to Honolulu, we had ssambap, which is vegetable wrap with rice and bulgogi. It was one of the best airplane food meals I think I've ever had.

Great experience flying with Asiana Airlines - the service was excellent, food was great, and we arrived safely to Honolulu!

Have you flown on Asiana Airlines before?

----

6blLVatMkTo.title: Living in Thailand - MY BANGKOK HOUSE TOUR | $601.69 Per Month in BKK + Cost of Living!
6blLVatMkTo.description:
Living in Bangkok - House for $601.69 per month!
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

Ying and I do quite a bit of traveling and I've shown you some of the places we stay on our trips, from Airbnbn apartments to hotels.

But I still haven't yet given you a tour of the house we live in in Bangkok, Thailand! 

So here's our house - we're renting it right now in Bangkok. We live along with Ying's parents and her sister. There are five adults and one baby living in this house, and we still have 3 extra spare bedrooms!

Bangkok, Thailand living expenses / cost of living:
House rent - 20,000 THB ($601.69) per month
Electricity - 3,000 THB ($90.25) per month
Water - 250 THB ($7.52) per month
Internet - 1,200 THB ($36.10) per month

Overall, for the area we live in and the space of the house, for Bangkok we're getting a pretty good deal. You can get much cheaper places living in rural areas of Thailand, but in the city in a good location, this is a very good deal.

I hope this living in Thailand, Bangkok house tour gives you a good idea about living conditions and houses you could potentially rent in Bangkok.

Thank you for watching!

--

localized.title: Living in Thailand - MY BANGKOK HOUSE TOUR | $601.69 Per Month in BKK + Cost of Living!
localized.description:
Living in Bangkok - House for $601.69 per month!
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

Ying and I do quite a bit of traveling and I've shown you some of the places we stay on our trips, from Airbnbn apartments to hotels.

But I still haven't yet given you a tour of the house we live in in Bangkok, Thailand! 

So here's our house - we're renting it right now in Bangkok. We live along with Ying's parents and her sister. There are five adults and one baby living in this house, and we still have 3 extra spare bedrooms!

Bangkok, Thailand living expenses / cost of living:
House rent - 20,000 THB ($601.69) per month
Electricity - 3,000 THB ($90.25) per month
Water - 250 THB ($7.52) per month
Internet - 1,200 THB ($36.10) per month

Overall, for the area we live in and the space of the house, for Bangkok we're getting a pretty good deal. You can get much cheaper places living in rural areas of Thailand, but in the city in a good location, this is a very good deal.

I hope this living in Thailand, Bangkok house tour gives you a good idea about living conditions and houses you could potentially rent in Bangkok.

Thank you for watching!

8Q2XVXQEhXs.title: Thailand Beach House Tour -  FAMILY VACATION in Rayong, Thailand!
8Q2XVXQEhXs.description:
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

After returning home to Thailand from traveling in Indonesia, my wife and her sisters planned a family vacation to Rayong (about a 3 hour drive to Bangkok) on the beach.

We rented a family beach house, right along the ocean. It was a nice property, sort of reminded me of a camp like setting, and the house included nice places to sit and private individual rooms. What I liked is that it was quiet and peaceful and you could do all your own cooking.

The property is called Baan Kaiwan (บ้านไกวัล although I saw on Google they sometimes spell is Baan Kai Val).

Price - 9,000 THB ($274.91) per night - I thought it was a little expensive for what you get - but I guess you pay to be right by the beach, and I think we might have gotten a higher rate because we were there on the weekend on a holiday.

--
