Iac5AXpO6os.title: Garuda Indonesia Airline FOOD REVIEW - Flying from Lombok to Jakarta to Bangkok
Iac5AXpO6os.description:
Flying on Garuda Indonesia Airline from Lombok to Jakarta to Bangkok!
Subscribe here► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

September 2017

On our way back from Lombok to Bangkok, my wife, baby son, and I flew with Garuda Indonesia, the airline of Indonesia. It was my first time to fly with them, and overall the flights were very nice and service was good. I was also impressed that, even though we were in economy class, even on the short flight from Lombok to Jakarta, they served us a meal.

The newly opened Jakarta International Airport terminal for Garuda Indonesia was also very nice, newly opened, and extremely clean. On my previous trip to Jakarta they new airport hadn't been opened yet.

The food on Garuda Indonesia Airline was decent, not the best airplane food I've had, but ok. 

Thank you for watching this Garuda Indonesian Airline review video!

ywUsQt49hBE.title: Living in Bali - RICE PADDY VILLA TOUR | Balinese House in Indonesia $77 Per Night!
ywUsQt49hBE.description:
I booked this Balinese Villa on Airbnb► https://goo.gl/yWJmFA (use my affiliate link for $33 off your first booking)
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

September 2017

Price - I paid  $77 USD per night for this full Balinese villa in the rice paddies

During our trip to Bali, I really wanted to stay in a Balinese villa, specifically surround by rice fields. So after some searching I found a place near Ubud that looked very quiet and nice.

It was a beautiful place, very relaxing and I enjoyed the entire community.

We had 2 full rooms, a swimming pool, a kitchen, and a living space. And one of the best things about staying in a Balinese villa in the rice paddies is being able to take walks and just enjoying the incredible countryside of Bali.

Our host family that owns the villa was also very kind and welcoming.

A few drawbacks:
- It's a little isolated, and you have to walk or take a motorbike out to the main road. So you have to pre-arrange transportation everyday.
- Unless you go out of the neighborhood there are no really local food options.

But overall, my family and I really enjoyed our stay.

Thank you for watching!

If you want to use Airbnb, you can use my affiliate link here: https://goo.gl/yWJmFA to get $33 off your first booking. Here's the exact place: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/12996050

Y8aqakNL8No.title: Bali LUXURY BEACH RESORT - Full Tour and Review of  Sofitel Hotel in Bali,  Indonesia!
Y8aqakNL8No.description:
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

NOTE: I did some hosting work for Accor Hotels at Sofitel, and they invited my wife and I to stay for a few extra nights. So I didn't pay for my stay, but I wasn't required in any way to make this video. I made it because I wanted to.

September 2017

Sofitel is one of the well known beach resorts in Nusa Dua, Bali. They hooked us up with a very nice room with direct access to the swimming pool -  which is  probably one of the coolest features of the hotel. The service was great, and I think the breakfast buffet was excellent. It's a laid back place to stay in Bali, so laid back and relaxing, that my wife and I barely even wanted to go anywhere when we were staying there. Sofitel in Bali is the type of resort where you can just stay the entire day, relaxing, and swimming and not go anywhere.

As for the beach, it's not the most amazing beach. The views are fantastic, but for actually beach swimming, it's not the best you'll see. Also another drawback I found is that Nusa Dua is kind of a secluded resort area in Bali. So in order to get our of the resort area you need to take a  taxi, you can't just walk out and find street food.

Again, I didn't pay, but I searched and found that this room sometimes goes for around $400, however it could fluctuate quite a bit by season - and I was there in high season.

Thank you to Sofitel Nusa Dua Bali for hosting my family in Bali. We had an amazing stay.

Thank you for watching!

--

mThQUvsz_CA.title: AirAsia FOOD REVIEW - Flying From Bangkok to Denpasar, Bali!
mThQUvsz_CA.description:
Flying on AirAsia from Bangkok to Bali!
Subscribe here► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

August 2017

For this flight, my wife and I were doing some filming for Accor Hotels, and so we flew from Bangkok to Denpasar, Bali, in Indonesia with AirAsia.

Now, over the years I've taken AirAsia many many times because they offer some of the best budget flights around SouthEast Asia. But food is always extra cost and haven't ever bought it.

But since my flight this time was sponsored by the company, they included it in my ticket. 

They had already pre-booked my meal option, so I didn't have a choice of what to order, but my meal was chicken Manchurian. Turned out to be not the greatest airplane meal I've ever had.

My advice, make sure you always eat before you get on your AirAsia flight!

But we arrived safely and fine to Bali.

Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

August 2017

Price - I paid  $106 USD per night for this full house

On my trip to Dubai, my wife, son, and I rented a serviced apartment at Dubai Marina, Jumeirah Beach in Dubai. The location in southern Dubai, is kind of a enclave of tall building and it's  extremely modern. It's a good area to stay, though next trip to Dubai, I would probably choose to stay more in the downtown area.

The apartment was very luxurious, and extremely spacious and comfortable. It's a huge apartment complex that includes just about everything you could need all within the compound - supermarket, pharmacy, and many other things.

Overall, a very nice apartment in Dubai - and it was a very good deal renting it short term in comparison to paying for a hotel room.

Thank you for watching!

If you want to use Airbnb, you can use my affiliate link here: https://goo.gl/yWJmFA to get $33 off your first booking.

Xh12yb0WPAw.title: Best of Athens Travel Guide! | Attractions, Food, and Tips for Visiting Athens, Greece!
Xh12yb0WPAw.description:
Thank you for watching this Athens travel guide!
Watch my Greek food videos► https://youtu.be/Kvg9kJ35jEY
Subscribe for new videos► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad

Best of Athens Travel Guide!

In this Athens travel guide video, you'll find practical information and tips about the top things to do in Athens, some of the best restaurants I tried, accommodation tips, and transportation.

ARRIVING:

Athens International Airport
Taxi - 38 Euros
Metro - 10 Euros per person

ACCOMMODATION:

I stayed in Koukaki Neighborhood, but I would recommend anywhere near to the Acropolis if you are visiting Athens.

Airbnb Apartment - I booked my Athens apartment on Airbnb and paid $78.67 USD per night► https://goo.gl/yWJmFA (use my affiliate link for $33 off your first booking).

ATTRACTIONS:

Acropolis of Athens
Temple of Olympian Zeus
Philopappos Hill
Panathenaic Stadium
Monastiraki Flea Market
National Archaeological Museum

Combined ticket - 30 Euros
http://odysseus.culture.gr/h/3/eh355.jsp?obj_id=2384

RESTAURANTS:

Mam - Cheese pie
Kostas Soulvaki - pork souvlaki
Souvlaki Lefteris o Politis - kebab spicy souvlaki
Diporto - old style Athens food
Taverna Agrinio - amazing grilled meat
Taverna Moschos - seafood
Taverna To Trigono - grilled meat, incredible lamb

TRANSPORTATION:

Metro - 1.40 Euro
Bus
Taxi - Taxibeat (Beat) app

Thank you for watching this Athens travel guide video. Hope it helps you plan about some of the best things to do in Athens, and especially where to eat when you're in Athens!

--

G0pVO8tqhlM.title: Athens Neighborhood Tour - Old Greek Coffee Shop, Convenience Kiosk, and Evening Walk!
G0pVO8tqhlM.description:
Koukaki Neighborhood, Athens, Greece
Apartment where I stayed in Athens► https://youtu.be/rErSbUb0Jqc
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

August 2017 -

Athens is a very interesting city, full of unique charms, and fascinating history. In this video, I head out on a neighborhood evening walk  to just discover what's around the area.

If you're in the area, Dio Dekares i Oka Restaurant is a great local Greek restaurant where you can enjoy a home-cooked style feast.

We first walked over to a classic old style Greek coffee shop, and I had a double Greek coffee. It was a pretty cool place, very classic. My double coffee - 2 EUR 

Next we stopped off at a neighborhood convenience store and bought some gum.

Geor. Olimpiou Walking Street - This is a wonderful walking street full of restaurants and cafes. If you come here, you can eat some delicious grilled meat at this restaurant: https://youtu.be/B9YYr6BONYg

And that completes this Athens evening walk and neighborhood tour.

Thank you very much for watching and I'll see you on the next travel video!

--

rErSbUb0Jqc.title: Living in Greece - ATHENS APARTMENT TOUR | $78.67 Per Night!
rErSbUb0Jqc.description:
I booked this Athens apartment on Airbnb and paid $78.67 USD per night► https://goo.gl/yWJmFA (use my affiliate link for $33 off your first booking).
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/c/markabroad
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

JULY 2017

When my wife and I visited Athens, Greece, we decided to rent an apartment for accommodation during out stay.

Although the apartment doesn't look that great from the outside, the inside was very nice, and very classic. The owner did a great job of decorating so it was slightly arty, yet still clean and very comfortable. Although we didn't have a view of the acropolis from the balcony, the apartment was located very close to the Athens Acropolis, and just a short walk from Syngrou Fix station.

I paid $78.67 per night, for my wife and I and our baby. We chose a place that  was more pricey because it was bigger and had a couple of closed door rooms, which we need these days when we travel with a baby. 

If you rent an apartment or plan to live in Greece or Athens, you'll get a much better price than what I paid just for a few days stay. But I hope this video gives you an idea / glimpse into living in Greece!

If you want to use Airbnb, you can use my affiliate link here: https://goo.gl/yWJmFA to get $33 off your first booking.

--

Fp0639W2lAk.title: Aegean Airlines FOOD REVIEW - Flying from Munich to Athens, Greece!
Fp0639W2lAk.description:
We flew on Aegean Airlines (Greece national carrier) from Munich to Athens.
Subscribe ► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

JULY 2017

To get from Munich to Athens, my wife and I flew on Aegean Airlines, the Greece national airline. In this video, I'll give you a full review of our flight and especially show you the food on the flight and at the Munich Airport.

First of all, we arrived to Munich Airport, and we were really hungry. I didn't know at the time, but Munich Airport is ranked as one of the best in the world, and it's very nicely designed.

First, we stopped at Dallmayr, a German cafe and restaurant to have breakfast. Total price - 32.70 EUR

Our flight left on time, and we were served a full lunch on Aegean Airlines including pasta and chicken. It was alright, not bad at all.

There's wasn't too much leg space on our plane, but overall, it was a great flight with Aegean Airlines.

Thank you for watching this airplane food flight review!

SOCIAL MEDIA: 
My main channel: http://www.youtube.com/user/migrationolgy
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/migrationololgy
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/migrationology

--

taHZ7X-CWF8.title: Germany Train FOOD REVIEW - Traveling from Munich to Zurich, Switzerland!
taHZ7X-CWF8.description:
Traveling on the train from Munich to Zurich!
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

JULY 2017

I was in Munich, and my wife and her sister all of a sudden decided they wanted to go to Zurich, Switzerland. So the night before we left, I bought tickets on the train, direct from Munich to Zurich on Bahn.com.

We arrived at the Munich Central train station, which is a very nice and spacious station, and our first mission was to buy some train food. I ended up with a wonderful pretzel and a Bavarian sandwich. The sandwiches were pretty amazing.
Sandwiches and coffee - 12.50 EUR

It was a great ride, and as we kept going the views and mountains kept getting more and more beautiful.

For the train we were 3 adults and I paid about 400 EUR for round-trip ticket from Munich to Zurich.

Train is always one of the best ways to travel!

localized.title: Germany Train FOOD REVIEW - Traveling from Munich to Zurich, Switzerland!
localized.description:
Traveling on the train from Munich to Zurich!
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

JULY 2017

I was in Munich, and my wife and her sister all of a sudden decided they wanted to go to Zurich, Switzerland. So the night before we left, I bought tickets on the train, direct from Munich to Zurich on Bahn.com.

We arrived at the Munich Central train station, which is a very nice and spacious station, and our first mission was to buy some train food. I ended up with a wonderful pretzel and a Bavarian sandwich. The sandwiches were pretty amazing.
Sandwiches and coffee - 12.50 EUR

It was a great ride, and as we kept going the views and mountains kept getting more and more beautiful.

For the train we were 3 adults and I paid about 400 EUR for round-trip ticket from Munich to Zurich.

Train is always one of the best ways to travel!

AbL2Ci2GYMQ.description:
We flew on Emirates Airline from Bangkok to Dubai to Munich!
Subscribe ► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

JULY 2017 - My wife and I live in Bangkok, but we took a trip to Munich Germany. One of the most affordable airlines that has plenty of flights connecting Asia and Europe is Emirates Airlines.

Emirates has consistently been rated as one of the best airlines in the world. We flew economy class, and thanks to baby Micah we had pretty good seats in the front with nice legroom.

We first flew from Bangkok to Dubai, with a layover at Dubai International Airport, and then on from Dubai to Bangkok.

The food on Emirates economy class is pretty decent. It doesn't have that real artificial taste you get on some airplane food.

Staff was ok, but not amazing on our flight. But overall, very nice airplanes, and good flight all the way to Munich.

Izb9-YKMdac.title: Living in Israel - TEL AVIV APARTMENT TOUR | Amazing Rooftop Terrace!
Izb9-YKMdac.description:
I booked this Tel Aviv apartment on Airbnb and paid $114 USD per night► https://goo.gl/yWJmFA (use my affiliate link for $32 off your first booking).
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

July 2017 - For this trip to Israel, my wife and I rented an apartment in Tel Aviv, Israel, and used it as our base to explore the region. From the outside, the neighborhood and buildings look a little old and run down, but on the inside, the apartment that we rented was superb. It was spacious, perfectly laid out, and what I especially loved, and I think you will too, is the outdoor terrace / balcony. The weather was perfect in July, a little warm in the sun, but in the shade on the ends of the day on the balcony it was amazing to sit outside.

I hope you enjoyed this Tel Aviv apartment tour and that it gives you a glimpse into local living in Tel Aviv. I found Tel Aviv to be a very expensive city to live and travel in. I rented this apartment on Airbnb for $114 per night for a very short term stay, that's why it was expensive, but rent by the month can also be quite expensive in central Tel Aviv. In comparison to hotels in Tel Aviv though, for that amount of space, I found them to be quite expensive and in high demand as well.

My wife, son, and I had a great stay at this apartment in Tel Aviv!

If you want to use Airbnb, you can use my affiliate link here: https://goo.gl/yWJmFA to get $32 off your first booking.

l0raUAqg5Ds.title: Munich Neighborhood Tour - Living in Germany, Supermarket, Parks, and Beer Garden!
l0raUAqg5Ds.description:
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

JULY 2017 - 

When my wife and I travel, we usually like to rent local apartments / houses to stay in rather than hotels - especially since we have a baby it makes it easier. But additionally, it also allows you to stay in a local neighborhood where you can experience the normal everyday life in a country.

In this video, we just set off on a walk around the Munich neighborhood that were staying in. First we needed to get a few groceries from the supermarket, then we continued walking to the local parks (by the way, there are some truly beautiful parks in Munich and green spaces), then we continued walking to a little farmers market, and on finally to a local  beer garden which Munich is so famous for.

Hope you enjoyed this Munich, Germany neighborhood tour!

JULY 2017 - 

On this trip to Munich, Germany, rather than staying in a hotel, we decided to rent an Airbnb apartment in a local neighborhood in Munich. The prices are not cheap in Germany, but I think in comparison to what you get for a hotel room, it's still a very good value. I was with my wife, my wife's sister, and our baby Micah.

In this Munich apartment tour, I walk you through the apartment. It's just a 1 bedroom apartment, but it's really spacious and would be very comfortable living for a single or couple.

One thing I love most about living in Germany or renting an apartment in Munich / Germany, is that German design and the awareness of natural light in the house. During the day, you don't need to use any electricity for lighting.

Thank you for watching, I hope this gives you an idea about accommodation options in Munich, Germany if you plan to visit or to live in Germany.

AVrVlvlK6Wc.title: Japanese Ryokan Tour - AMAZING PRIVATE ONSEN in Hakone, Japan | $708.16 Per Night!
AVrVlvlK6Wc.description:
Staying at this Japanese ryokan (traditional inn) was truly incredible!
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

JUNE 2017 - 

Yoshiike Ryokan - I paid 77,760 Japanese Yen (at the time $708.16 USD) for 1 night for 2 adults, 1 baby. It was very expensive, but it was truly an amazing Japanese cultural experience and the food was incredible. There are cheaper Japanese ryokans you can stay at, but usually they have a public onsen (Japanese hot-spring bath), rather than a private.

Ever since taking my first trip to Japan a few years ago, I had really wanted to stay in a Japanese ryokan, which is a traditional inn, usually that is somewhere in the beautiful mountains, with a hotspring onsen bath, and delicious Japanese local food served in your room.

On my most recent trip to Tokyo, my wife and I took the train to Hakone, about 1.5 hours from Tokyo in the mountains, and decided to stay at a ryokan for 1 night. The experience was truly incredible and our room was amazing, including a private onsen bath and amazing Japanese gardens to view from the window.

Yoshiike Ryokan
５９７ Yumoto
箱根町 Hakone-machi, Ashigarashimo-gun, Kanagawa-ken 250-0311
Japan

Ryokan food video coming soon on Main Channel!

L2y_ZlaYSuk.title: Japanese Train FOOD REVIEW - Sushi and Bentos | Traveling Tokyo to Hakone, Japan!
L2y_ZlaYSuk.description:
Food is one of the best reasons to take a Japanese train trip!
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

When we were visiting Tokyo, my wife and I decided to take a short trip for a night to Hakone, a well known mountainous area, home to hot springs and Japanese traditional inns. We took the train from Shinjuku in Tokyo straight to Hakone-Yumoto Station within the town.

When you take a train in Japan, you are encouraged to eat, and so we stocked up on a few essentials before boarding.

Train trip rice - 2,050 JPY ($17.96) per person

Fish bento - 880 JPY ($7.71)
Beef bento - 1,150 JPY ($10.08)
Kansai sushi - 950 JPY ($8.32)
Katsu rice burger - 223 JPY ($1.95)

Don't forget to eat some awesome Japanese food when you take a train in Japan.

w5YUsS9iSYo.title: Living in Japan - TOKYO APARTMENT TOUR in Shinjuku | Where To Stay in Tokyo $60 Per Night!
w5YUsS9iSYo.description:
I booked this Tokyo apartment on Airbnb and paid $60 USD per night► https://goo.gl/yWJmFA (use my affiliate link for $32 off your first booking).
Subscribe► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts► https://migrationology.com/store/

MAY 2017 - My wife, baby son, and I stayed at this apartment in Tokyo for 1 week in May 2017. This was a great condo, located not far from the central Shinjuku area of Tokyo. One of the things I love most about living or visiting Japan is that the living spaces are so cosy and so comfortable. Even though you usually don’t have a lot of extra space or moving room, there’s everything you need in a Tokyo apartment in such a small space.

In this apartment in Tokyo, there was 1 bedroom, 1 living space with a small balcony attached, a small kitchen with a bar counter dining space, and finally a bathroom equipped with a life-changing Japanese Toto toilet and something completely new for me - a Japanese sitting shower.

Hope you enjoyed this Japan apartment tour in Tokyo. This is a little glimpse into the possibilities of living or staying in Japan and an apartment you can rent when you visit. I rented just for 1 week, so it was short term, for $60 per night. But renting an apartment like this per month should be much more affordable.

KhZ8krPACtw.title: Singapore Airlines FOOD REVIEW - Singapore to Bangkok | Singapore Changi Airport Tour!
KhZ8krPACtw.description:
Singapore Airlines is one of the world's best airlines!
Subscribe ► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxkF42nqXoZ0sZP-GqU-Cww
T-shirts ► https://migrationology.com/store/

June 2017 - I actually flew from Tokyo to Singapore to Bangkok (found a good deal on that flight), but just reviewed the flight from Singapore to Bangkok.

Singapore Changi Airport is one of the best airports in the world, decked out with lounges, sports tv areas, and leg massagers. If you need to have a lay-over somewhere, Singapore Changi Airport is a pretty good place for one.

On this Singapore Airlines flight we flew normal economy class from Singapore to Bangkok, and even on economy class, the seats were nice, and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The food didn't look all the great, but it actually came through, it was pretty good.

Thank you for watching and subscribe for more travel reviews!
